descriptions.overview: Handle any mowing conditions with this all-wheel-drive mower. The Husqvarna LC221A features an exclusive system that automatically shifts between two and four wheels and locks the front and rear differentials— no buttons or levers needed. You’ll enjoy full traction and superior performance on all types of turf, and damage to the grass will be greatly reduced thanks to the improved control. A hi-tunnel deck helps you get the job done. Choose between bagging, mulch and rear discharge with this efficient AWD mower.
list: Husqvarna 21 in. all-wheel drive mower is ideal for medium to large lawns with flat or hilly terrain
Powerful 163cc Briggs & Stratton engine is designed for robust all-wheel operation
Soft grip handle offers superior comfort and ergonomics and folds up for easier storage
Four-point cutting height adjustment allows for grass heights between 1 and 4-in
Exclusive and industry leading all-wheel drive system automatically shifts between 2 and 4-wheel drive operation for full traction and superior performance
3-in-1 cutting deck allows for mulching, side discharging or rear bagging via fabric soft bag with dust blocker
21 in., 15-gauge steel cutting deck delivers rugged and precise performance
Water hose connection facilitates cleaning of the cutting deck
3 year bumper-to-bumper warranty promises worry-free ownership and customer support

reviews.title: "LC221A self propelled lawn mower"
reviews.text: I really wanted to love this brand. I did extensive research and though this would be a great lawnmower for our 1/4 acre yard. Husqvarna typically seems to be a solid brand but after 1 cut of our backyard the mower started running really rough and shaking. White smoke started pouring out of the engine and it then shut down. It's really hot and there's oil all over the body of the mower making me think the gas and oil is mixing or there's a seal issue somewhere. We used top of the line gas and the oil provided. Since we had it less than 2 weeks I though I could take it back to Lowes but they wouldn't take it. I emailed Husqvarna and was told we need to take it into a certified engine repair shop. Uggg! I just want my boys to be able to cut the grass without the mower overheating and dying.
reviews.author: Erica

reviews.title: "What a difference"
reviews.text: I went from a Troy TB230 to this which was the same price.  My god what a difference.  I litterly do not have to push at all it and it will pull itself up hills.  It also acts like a vacuum cleaner it will grab EVERYTHING and put it in the bag.   In just 1/3 of my yard it picked up more stuff than my troy did mowing the whole thing 4 times.  Also you can actually tell when the bag is full it will keep jamming stuff in there until you need a crowbar to get the clippings out.  My yard is looking fantastic.  Can't wait for fall when I try it on the pine needle half of my yard.  I shouldn't have to rake that part this year :)  Did take some time to get used to the free wheel mode as your going when you let off the drive bar push forward another inch and you'll be able to pull it backwards freely.  Also put a zip tie on the drive bar and lift it up to the point where it would start engaging that way you don't have to reach as far to pull it up.  Also it's a bit fast running around a tree so let off on the bar a bit.  You can see in the photo where I ran behind it at full speed and the turf it threw up.
reviews.author: Eric

reviews.title: "Flawed AWD MOWER"
reviews.text: After twenty minutes of mowing the drive belts load up with debris.
reviews.author: Ted

reviews.title: "TERRIBLE!"
reviews.text: I've has this mower for 2 weeks and majorly regret buying it. The only good thing about this mower is that it looks nice but performance wise it's a joke. I was assured by lowes staff this was a good mower for my yard (just over 1/4 acre) but its exactly the opposite. It constantly shuts down and gets clogged, mind you I've used this thing twice. I'm truly appalled by the performance, or lack thereof. To say this thing can mulch is a crime, it certainly does not which is why it constantly gets clogged up. Also, it has EXTREMELY poor design which I didn't notice when I was purchasing it. Directly under the blades all the belts are completely exposed, as you can imagine grass and debris fly up into the belts and mower, causing it to clog, how they would launch a product with design flaws like this is beyond comprehension. If you have a lawn the size of a postage stamp and cut your grass every 3 days this mower may work for you, but if you cut your grass every weekend like most human beings avoid this mower like the plague. Major disappointment. Was also told by Lowe's I would have 30 days to return this product if I chose but by reading other reviews thay doesn't seem to be the case. I will still be attempting to return this, if I'm unable to I'll be taking my business to home depot in the future due to the misleading information I was given by lowes staff. Dont buy this mower, spend the extra money and get yourself a Honda, my neighbor has one and it works phenomenally! If I could give -5 stars I would.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A"
reviews.text: I bought this lawn mower as a floor model.  The oil filler hole is hard to get to and the use of a funnel is hard because of the plastic housing unless you use a very small funnel.  With the oil and gas added to the lawn mower I was expecting it to be difficult to start as it being new and there was no choke to use.  I was very surprised that I only had to pull the starting string (which required very little effort) a couple of times before it started.  The bag is also just the right size to fit into the lawn bags so its easy to empty.  I found controlling the pace of lawn mower easy all you do is control how much you pull on the bottom of the two levers.
reviews.author: Jazz

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: I was going to buy another toro but had   Numerous problems with them first lasted 10 years but was in an out of shop. This mower right out of the box was great. Easy to assemble.  Cut my lawn perfectly and faster than my old snapper. Used the bag first then mulched it was great. One pill and she runs great. After mowing I cleaned it very easy. I think that this is my new favorite power machine.  All you have to do is fill her with oil and gas. If any doubt make this  purchase it's worth it for $299.00 plus 10 percent military discount can't go wrong.
reviews.author: Slappy

reviews.title: "Buyer beware"
reviews.text: I bought this mower on 5/20/17.  After sitting with 93 octane zero ethanol fuel that had fuel stabilizer added from end of October to march of this year this mower would start.  It has a 3 year warranty from husqvarna so I took it back.  In order for you to get it looked at by them you must sign paperwork that you authorize up to 120 dollars of work to be done.  When you pick it up it stuff not covered by warranty i.e. bad gas and bad oil.  Mind you this one advertises no oil changes.  I had to pay 91 dollars or lower would keep my mower.  They don't call you ahead of time to let you know what the charges will be and you find out only when you go to pick up your mower.  Not right.
reviews.author: Rob

reviews.title: "OK, Design Problems"
reviews.text: I have had this mower for a month.  The drive system is very poorly designed.  The belts and drives are all exposed under the mower deck.  Therefore I had a belt come off the second time the mower was operated.  The fix was easy, just loosen a screw and place the belt back in the drive, but I see this being a frequent occurrence in the future.  The drive should not be exposed as it is, Husqvarna is just asking for problems there.  I see the belts wearing extremely fast due to this exposure as well. I am very surprised buy the design Husqvarna generally makes excellent products.I would pass if I were to purchase again...
reviews.author: EKIM

reviews.title: "It's a work horse so I don't have to be"
reviews.text: I picked this up after looking at the options. It's got a 2 yr warranty so I decided to go with this since it was on sale and it's got a Honda engine. This thing literally starts up on 1st or second pull. I only gave it 4 stars because I had to empty the bag a lot. Which may not be the mowers fault . My grass was out of control. Once you dial this in to the height you want it and get used to the all wheel drive feature it's worth every penny. I almost wish we'd get more rain in SoCal so I can use it again.
reviews.author: RustyHammer

reviews.title: "Excellent Mower"
reviews.text: Simple as out of the box and use. Easy to put together took about 1/2 hr, put oil in (don't forget the oil) gas it up. I recommend waiting a few minutes after the gas is in for it to fill the lines as it's a gravity fed system. Started on the second try. The AWD is awesome it's almost effortless to push. The grass bag is an easy on off on to clean out. It's hose connection for clean up after use is a great idea as dry grass can build up and effect the belt. Just connect the hose turn the water on and watch all the grease that would be stuck wash off. All in all I would say this is a well built thought out mower. Would recommend for sure.
reviews.author: charlie

reviews.title: "Just purchased and It's running well. Powerful."
reviews.text: After returning the one I originally purchased because it was billowing out white smoke and 'spitting' oil everywhere, Lowe's exchanged it for another Mower, which worked perfectly. My yard has some uneven hills and this mower did the job with minimal effort. Both the rear bag and the mulching features are good. Also, this Mower is easy to maintain and clean. The air filter, spark plug, gas and oil areas are all easily accessible. I will recommend Husqvarna Mowers and Lowe's. If any issues develop, I will follow up. However, with routine maintenance as recommended, I expect this Mower to last for a very long time.
reviews.author: AC

reviews.title: "Repeated Mechanical failure"
reviews.text: I bought this machine on father's day 2016 by April I have had a first engine failure. Lowe's said that I have to send it to the manufacturer. The website has a list of maintenance and service providers in my zip code! Since, the starter died on me, the coil was replace, the engine stopped running without warning, I was told that carburetor may have water, this weekend the gear does not even engage.I cleaned up my Toro of (12 years) it worked so well that I totally regretted switching. I will not recommend the Husqvarna Lc221A 163cc 21 and I will certainly never purchase it again.
reviews.author: Greenmower

reviews.title: "I love the all wheel drive"
reviews.text: I have used lots of mowers over the years.  Like most mowers now days, this one starts up with one or two pulls.  What makes this mower stand out is the all wheel drive. The entire mower stays on the ground when climbing a steep grade. It also keeps a straight line - no wiggling back and forth while trying to get traction.  The mower is also light enough to maneuver in tight spots.  The bagging capacity is quite adequate and doesn't clog easily. the design allow for maximum bag filling before need to empty.What kept me from giving this a 5, is the shoot design for bagging. While it bags nicely, I noticed a hole in the bag after a few uses.  The plastic guard rubs the bag in such a way that friction is tearing it. (see picture)  I put duct tape over it to protect it from tearing further.  Husqvarna replaced the bag for me  -- great customer support.
reviews.author: Gaz

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY"
reviews.text: First of all I want to start with the good... The Briggs and Stratton engine on this mower is simply fabulous didn't even hesitate in the deepest area of my grass and it is very thick new sod  Now for the not so good... by staying rear discharge they should clarify that no matter what you do it is going to discharge grass out the rear of the mower the entire time while you mow bag on or not!  They were very correct by placing stickers all over the mower stating that it is a fire hazardbecause massive amounts of grass pile up on top of the extremely hot engine non-stop while you mow. Very happy with Briggs and Stratton engine but the extremely poor door/bag design really deserves a 0! There is no way Husqvarna is doing any quality control at all because this product never should have left the factory. This ones going back and Husqvarna has lost my business.
reviews.author: Steed

reviews.title: "I wish there was an option for 0 stars"
reviews.text: Purchased this lawnmower because it had the features I was looking for at a decent price.  It turns out, all lawnmowers are not created equal.  There is a major design flaw where the bands for the AWD system clog with grass and subsequently seize the blade and stall the engine.  This would happen about 7 times while cutting a small lawn with grass that wasn't that high. I had to stop and clean out with a putty knife each time this happened.  I returned it to Lowe's after two weeks and got a Honda mower.  It is a completely different experience!  No clogs or stalling.
reviews.author: Adam

reviews.title: "Worst mower I've ever owned"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower on March 19th and have had the displeasure of using it 5 times.  It has been in the repair shop once.  On the third use it died out of the blue.  Gas and oil levels were fine.  It would simply start up and then die a few seconds later.  I took it to a repair guy who said the carburetor and air filter needed cleaning.  He did this and it worked fine after the next mow.  However the second time after the repair the same problems developed as before.  There is obviously something more seriously wrong than an air filter and dirty carburetor.  This is totally unacceptable for a mower that retails for this kind of money.  I have never had a mower do this kind of thing after dozens of uses, let alone five.  I'll never buy a Husqvarna product again.
reviews.author: LtColBuckRobley

reviews.title: "Solid mower!"
reviews.text: I assembled the few parts that needed to be assembled, less than 5 minutes. My wife generally mows the lawn. Yesterday, I took a closer look at it and noticed a blue fitting mounted to the deck. It occurred to me it was a hose fitting so that you can run water to it. I connected the hose and turned the water on. I started the engine to get a thorough soaking of the underside to clean the grass clippings off; worked fantastically! Now I could have spent another $50-$60 for the same model with a Honda engine, but I have never has problems with a Briggs & Stratton.
reviews.author: Rimfire64

reviews.title: "Great Machine so Far"
reviews.text: I just bought this machine yesterday and after the easy set up it was ready to go.  Everything came preassembled which total time from unpacking to start time was a half hour.  All that I had to do was to tighten the bolts to put the handle in position.  The oil was easy to administer as the fill cap is on the top right of the machine.  I filled it with 87 octane gas and it started right up on the first pull.  A bit of smoke came out but that was explained in the instructions so no worries.  The AWD feature was one main reason I bought this machine as I have a hilly terrain.  I heard that Husqvarna was a good brand so I bought this with the help from other reviews on this.  I figured to write this review now so others can expect what the process is.  I hope this helps as the other reviews helped me.  Hope to use this machine for many years to come.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: "Husqvarna customer service"
reviews.text: Husqvarna cuatomer service is hard to deal with.  The dont respond to emails.  My hand was bent when I bought it.  Had a choice to take my brand new never used lawn mover to get warranty service and wait for it to be fixed or what I thought would be easier, call CS and ask them to sent me a new handle.  This took several hours and 4 phone calls.  2 weeks have gone by since I bought this mower, still dont have the new handle.Mower starts great, mows great.  Turning can be tricky.  Backing up difficult.   The front wheel do not turn when pulling the mower backwards.
reviews.author: Louis

reviews.title: "HusqvarNOT!"
reviews.text: This is the second summer with this model and it's been nothing but headaches and nightmares. I echo the known issues repeated here in other reviews - because of poor design of exposing the self propelled internals, it shredded a belt and broke a pulley from the flinging debris - which is not covered under warranty if foreign objects caused the break. You got me on your convenient little loophole, Husqvarna. Never again. And the newest issue is the blade locks up after it heats up. Can't even pull the rope. It's been in repair multiple times - I now have $175 cost in repair for a $300 plus lawn mower. Sometimes you just have to cut your losses. Retired it to the basement and bought a Kobalt.
reviews.author: NapalmTom

reviews.title: "What a hassle"
reviews.text: This lawn mower is good when it's brand new but after a months of use I have a hard time starting it. It will cut out once I do get it started then can't start it up again afterwards. I'm pretty sure the carburetor is flawed but on a new mower shouldn't it last longer? I use 91 octane oil is perfect. I have many other small engine tools as well with no issues because I keep everything maintained well. Very disappointed in this product
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Very Happy Buyer !"
reviews.text: After 2 years of fighting with a new lawnboy to start ,many wasted hours of my life that I will never get back..   I just had the carb rebuilt and guess what ....it wouldn't start ...  I just bought the Husqvarna AWD , took it out of the box ,15 min later I was cutting grass , it flies up my hill with the AWD faster then I could imagined . I hope and pray that I will be this happy in a year when I start it up for another season of grass cutting ..
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "Great little mower!!"
reviews.text: I have not had a push mower in quite a while.  However my riding lawnmower finally died last fall and I have been looking for a replacement.  After reading reviews and tons of articles, I decided to settle on this one.  I have a .87 acre lot.  So probably just over a true .50 acre to mow.   I was concerned about going from a riding to a push mower.  But I was wrong.  This little mower has been really enjoyable.  Its easy to set up.  Its also got decent power.   My yard is sloped and I didn't know how the AWD would do on it.   It literally pulls me up the hills with no problems at all. I am amazed that it starts with one pull each time.  This may be common now, but my experience with push mowers was yanking a ton before it stated.  It does fairly good on tall grass (4-5in.).   You can here that the engine struggles a bit but the results are a nice clean cut.   If you are going to be mowing extremely high grass you may want to look for a mower with a larger engine.  But for the majority of owners this mower should do the job very well.  I'm sold on the AWD and impressed with the initial quality of this mower. It had much more metal that the Troy Built's seem to have.  The handle attachment and height adjustments are all metal.  I haven't bagged all that much yet so I can't speak to that aspect.  But the mulching capabilities exceeded my expectations.  Overall I'm very impressed with the initial quality and performance of this mower.
reviews.author: Danno

reviews.title: "Good mower"
reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 6.25 HP Husq mower that had a broken drive cable. This one at 7.25 HP is definitely better for a large lawn with thick growth. The gas filler hole is big and easy to use. One thing to note is the wheel height adjustment. The directions say to increase cutting height, move the wheel levers (as in all the levers) towards the center of the mower. In reality this applies only to the front levers. To raise the height you need to move the rear levers away from the center of the mower (i.e., same direction as the front ones).
reviews.author: RW

reviews.title: "Dont waste your money."
reviews.text: I bought this lawn mower based off a relatives review. He works for the company and I wantes to show support. Lets just say thats the last time.. I've had this lawn mower for almost 2 years now. I've probably spent more time fixing the thing then i have mowing my grass. The AWD is awesome when it works. I've got about and acre of land and some thick grass. If my grass gets even the slightest to high it wraps its self around the drive shafts. Once there is too much grass wrapped around them the AWD stops working, and its impossible to push this mower without the awd. Also, I am constantly fixing the belt that runs everything. It seems like I'm constantly fixing one or the other. Lastly trying to bag your lawn clippings with this mower is impossible. My lawn clippings just get caught in the hole of the mower and never make it to the bag. Honestly the only plus side to this mower is the low maintenance engine. Other then that this mower is garbage.
reviews.author: TheOtherGuy2112

reviews.title: "Great mower worth the money!"
reviews.text: Super great mower!! I love it! It makes mowing the yard less of a chore. It comes completely ready to go! Simply tightin it up add some oil and gas and mow it down! When using the bag It fills quick because it gets every piece of grass! If you don't want to hire and landscaping crew anymore to make you yard look great I would get one of these mowers! I have three yards to mow. About an acre of grass. It's completely changed my three yards. The awd works amazing. It's pulls me up the hills on one of the yards.
reviews.author: Josh

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A  Initial Impression"
reviews.text: Just purchased this machine today in Yuma, Arizona after researching various mowers on the market. The reviews by other purchasers influenced my decision to purchaser this particular mower.  Lowes had taken $40.00 of the regular price. It was very easy to assemble right out of the box.  All I had to do was add oil. I added gasoline and it started up on the fourth pull. I mowed the yard and it seems to have plenty of power. I am very satisfied with this machine so far. Although I have used it less than one hour I am rating it 5 stars based on my initial impression and brief usage.
reviews.author: dave

reviews.title: "Not what I expected.  It was better."
reviews.text: I waited to write this review since I used reviews before purchasing this machine and found them very helpful.  So I will return the favor and hope that it helps you.   I bought mine two mowing seasons ago and about to start the third.  I felt like I needed to go through at least one year before putting out my review, so here it is.  This machine is a fantastic purchase for push mowers.  My yard isn't big enough for a rider but I couldn't keep pushing any more so I looked at the all wheel drive ones that were out there.  After reviews I pulled the trigger on this one.  Very glad I did.  First, the set up is fairly easy once out of the box.  Do what you need to do with the oil and start up instructions and you won't have any problems.  Starts on the first pull every time! When I first looked at it, it was advertised with a Honda motor but when I purchased it, it came with a Briggs and Straton one, which bothered me at first but after 2 years it is still going strong with absolutely no issues.  Just do the preventative maintenance.  Next, the all wheel drive is incredible.  But go easy cause at first the speed goes rather quickly and it will go.  Good power for the drive. Takes a little bit of getting used to if you haven't owned one of these before.  The corners and the back ups take a little getting used to.The bagging part is good but the placement of the hookup and removing it under the push bars gets a little tiresome but you can get used to it.  A TIP: Don't bag every time. I change the height of my mowing.  Mow once lower and bag, then on the next mow, cut it a little higher and mulch.  It not only helps the lawn but it helps your back too! One nice surprise is the amount of gas it uses. It doesn't use very much.  It is very fuel efficient.  I purchase about 2 gals of gas for this puppy and it lasts me the whole spring and summer mowing season.  I used to buy 4 gals with my old Walmart mower.  So there's that.  Cleaning it is easy.  Mine came with the hose attachment for cleaning underneath but it's hard to see.  I just finish mowing and take the hose to it on top and then I lean the mower back to see the underneath and wash that off.  Warning: Do this in the backyard or in an inconspicuous area because the left over cut grass will get messy. Overall, I am beyond satisfied with this mower.  Gotta say that I now expect this machine to last me a few more years without many issues so long as it gets taken care of.  Like anything else, if you keep up with the low maintenance on it, it shouldn't be a problem for you either.   Thanks Husqvarna for a quality product and Thanks Lowe's for stocking and supporting them!
reviews.author: RangerDoc

reviews.title: "Terrible Mower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower to basically cut about 1/4 acre of my lawn that is a pain to cut with a tractor.  The first 3 times I used it, I was pretty pleased.  It started right up, cut pretty well (even though it was a little light on power), and the self-propelled system worked great.  By the fourth cut, it was stalling out often, and finally cut out and would not start back up.  Same gas, from same gas can I had used to fill it up before.  Not worth me diagnosing the problem (oil in the filter, etc) because having a mover that stopped working in less than 30 days and 4 cuts was not worth the headaches.  I bought the mower because my Dad's small engine equipment from this brand worked forever (chainsaws, weed whackers, etc).  Whether I got a bad mower from a good company or the company has gone downhill, I can not say.  Will be hesitant to buy products made by this company again.  To Lowe's credit, they took the mower back with no hassle.
reviews.author: Chuck

reviews.title: "Cut's nicely, but have much AWD criticism"
reviews.text: First one purchased had to be returned and replaced because the AWD stopped working after the first 15 minutes. IT WAS BRAND NEW! Vendor gave me another brand new one no questions asked. That 2nd device worked for the rest of the fall season. Come Spring, the AWD failed after the first use. UGH. Had to take it to authorized repair to get fixed. After 3 weeks in repair shop (!) repairing the belt drives, it's cut and driven just fine. Fingers crossed. I would also say it drives too fast. Not much speed control. Either I'm running after it, or have to push it. Not much in-between. It needs a variable speed. Needless to say, I'm not impressed much by the AWD.
reviews.author: Jayhawkmike

reviews.title: "Multiple issues."
reviews.text: First the good: The motor always starts, generally in 2 pulls. It works great on an embankment I can't take my zero turn on, a little underpowered, but I probably should have bought the more powerful unit, my mistake.Now the bad. The 4WD system failed within the first 2 weeks. While it was covered under warranty, having the warranty people make no sense after a couple of phone calls, I went ahead and just ordered a new front drive unit online. Installation wasn't bad, but necessitated pretty much dismantling the mower. One that was fixed, a week later the bearings that the drive belt runs on, seized. Once again, dealing with Lowes on a warranty was problematic, but, having an engineering background,and after careful inspection, I realized that the bearings are basically push fit into the pulleys. I sourced some better quality dual sealed bearings and installed them myself. Since then, it's been pretty much trouble free. Probably a great mower for people who don't have rapid growing grass, I'll more than replace this one in another year.
reviews.author: V65racer

reviews.title: "Excellent !"
reviews.text: Easy to set up, started on the first light pull (always)and almost pulled me off my feet. The all wheel drive has got a lot of traction which is great for rough terrain and steep hills. I was surprised with the amount of pull it has. I'm very happy with this machine and would certainly buy it again.
reviews.author: Papatuco

reviews.title: "The Pros and Cons of this mower and why its 3 star"
reviews.text: First lets go with the pros of this, Very easy to assemble pull it out of box lift handles put them in place and scree in place put the pull cord in holder. Put wheels at level you want. Gas and oil in and you are ready to go. You are not pushing it when AWD works. Starts up really easy prime the engine and pull the cord and it starts up in a pull or two. Now lets go to the cons. You have to push forward to disengage the AWD if you don't wheels do not turn and drag. Does not have side discharge have to pay more money to get that. Drive belt is open underneath and everything gets into so it stops it and slows it down if you want to use it for the mulching part and not using the bag. Grass can't be high if you want to use it for mulching if it is it bogs it down and shuts the AWD down. Can't really set a speed on this one like the others to me this one is all of nothing because if you let it out it acts like it does not want to run. Gas Cap does not want to sit correctly sometimes and if you push it under bushes it turns and leaks gas. (I do like that they have the the gas cap sorta locked into the gas can so it does not fall off when it comes loose) I have had my mower for just over a year actually one year 2 months. the AWD has gone out on it twice first time while under the manufacture warranty the second time was under Lowes 4 year warranty and was told that (I have to clean the wheels out because of debris that it was general maintenance and was not under my Lowes 4 year warranty.) I am not happy with my lowes at all even though they compensated me. I feel like i have wasted my money on a 4 year warranty and i am not completely happy with my mower. Needs a better design to it (cover the belt up so debris can not get into it damage it like it has for me the last two times)Also i would love to have someone explain to me the general maintenance concept of me having to open the wheels to clean them out so the AWD will work.
reviews.author: Zachary

reviews.title: "Awesome Mower"
reviews.text: Very Skeptical at first thought due to the Briggs and Stratton engine, as I have always used Honda. I have owned it now for little over a month and I must say from unboxing to the first use took 5 minutes at most and this thing has always only taken 1 PULL to start. No choking, bulb priming just pull and get ready for an effortless mowing session.  Easy to maneuver and very powerful making for a perfect cut of my St. Augustine grass. Love this thing. Only petty thing I don't like and will be adding is a shut off valve to run all gas out of carb, otherwise a great deal and value for such an impressive mower. And yes I am a very picky individual and would buy it all over again.
reviews.author: Vance

reviews.title: "Find something else"
reviews.text: Had this mower for one season.  Ordered anther set of the drive pulleys.  That's NINE in just over a year.  Second Husqvarna AWD, last one went three seasons on one set. The sealed bearings are failing too quickly.  Going to try pressing in my own sourced bearings.  Failing that, might time to try another brand.
reviews.author: JC

reviews.title: "Poor Quality Mower"
reviews.text: I've owned my mower less than a year and have had multiple problems with it since purchasing it. It worked fine after the first 3 or 4 cuts then began malfunctioning after that. The mower wouldn't start on multiple occasions. When it did start it would shut off after about 30 minutes of mowing and then wouldn't restart. It had oil running off the sides even though the oil was at the right level. It also kept overheating after less than 30 minutes of mowing. Purchasing this mower was a waste of money since I ended up paying others to finish my yard on the multiple occasions the mower malfunctioned. Since it's still under warranty, I will take it to a dealer this week to see if they can resolve some of the issues and if the warranty lives up to the manufacturer's statement of worry free ownership.
reviews.author: Kaye

reviews.title: "It will pull you to your knees"
reviews.text: We have only had this mower for a few weeks. I was using in and thought I really like this mower. I did good going up the hill and mowing my back yard. I had a two wheel drive and thought if I had a 4 wheel drive if would be easier for me. WRONG....The belt jumped off and it wouldn't move so I started pushing it back to check it out. I tried using the drive thingy and it caught and pulled me to my knees and then never worked again. I am 73 years old and have mowed all my life and have used many different mowers over the years and this has never happened before. This is the first time for a Husqvarna and will be my last.
reviews.author: Unhappy Granny

reviews.title: "Lawsuit waiting to happen"
reviews.text: Husqvarna has always been a great product. This mower, however, has a back ejection, along with a bag and mulch feature. The back ejection has a plastic cover over it and supposedly blocks debris from hitting the operator. Not so. I mowed for about 15 minutes. In that time, two objects, either stones or sticks, flew back in my face stinging me. Glad it didn't hit my eye. The reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is because the all wheel drive is very good for going up hills. I brought the mower right back and purchased a Craftsman.
reviews.author: Kay

reviews.title: "Self propel failure"
reviews.text: I bought a Husqvarna LC221A because of the name and AWD.  The AWD worked great for a little over a year and because the cable stretched it stopped working.  Not covered by the warranty.  The bushing and some other parts of the self propel system also needed replacing.  Total cost $157.  A year later the same thing happened and cost a little more.  I can't justify spending $160 or more every year.  The motor is great and the frame is like new.  The repair shop indicated a heavier cable is needed to keep from stretching.  The pulleys and belts are open on the bottom of the frame and collect all of the dirt and grass.  A cover is needed badly to keep the bushings and pulleys from wearing out.  I no longer have the Husqvarna mower and will not ever buy another.
reviews.author: Ken

reviews.title: "Great Mower afteer 1 season of heavy use"
reviews.text: This is a great mower with power to spare even in very heavy, long grass. I have used it for one full year and onto the second, excellent on gas and very low maintenance. Easy to put together out of the box, not like my old push mower!!! The one issue is that it has an open area around the belt that allows grass to get up inside where the washing feature won't work. This spring the belt slipped off, due in part to the build up of clippings where I couldn't see. Had it fixed and the belt tightened, all of a 25$ cost so I am happy. The mechanic showed me to spray water up around the belt or blow it out with an air compressor to prevent the problem in the future. Overall I am very happy, just need to take care with cleaning. NOTE: This would probably not be a problem but I am often mowing very long grass with a mixture of wild grasses as well live in the country and the yard was native pasture. This is not likely to be a problem with planted lawns!!!
reviews.author: MLWA

reviews.title: "Smooth, Easy, Comfortable, Top of the line."
reviews.text: After purchasing a similar mower a week ago built by Craftsman which i had to return due to poor quality and a terrible feel, I was nervous to reinvest my money in another push mower. Let me tell you, It was WELL worth the gamble. You will not be disapointed by this mower. It was easy to start and the allwheel drive makes the mowing effortless. I mowed 2 acres with this mower today after I bought it and I wish I had more lawn to mow. It turns on a dime with the assist of the rear wheels, its easier to manipulate the wheel height to adjust to terrain and I felt like I was pushing a luxury cadillac. I would highly reccomend this mower and I am not sure why the ratings are so low. This is a 5 star mower, hands down.
reviews.author: Anthony-B

reviews.title: "Wont start after 6 months"
reviews.text: I brought the LC 221 AWD Husqavarna Lawn mower on JUN 17, 2017 and after 8 months now its not running. It would Just start for a second or two and shut down. I had brought this because husqavarna came highly recommended and their warranty support is like the run around. :( I hope they are repair its and not charge me arm and a leg since this is till under the 3 year warranty.
reviews.author: tom

reviews.title: "Buyer Beware"
reviews.text: This lawnmower is a piece of scrap metal.  First lawnmower the engine quit after mowing the lawn 3 times. (and no, grass wasn't high or wet).  The self propel stopped working on the replacement after 13 months.   I returned to Lowes and was told there is a 3 year manufacturer warranty.  I just received a call, they want nearly $450 to fix the pulley!  Yes....$450 for a lawnmower I purchased for $300.   Shame on you Husqvarna for not backing your product and having a fake warranty.
reviews.author: MJ

reviews.title: "damage after a month"
reviews.text: It was good at first read the reviews and manual, after one month the screw and plastic housing separated and had clunking noise it took me 5 tries to start it thereafter. Thank Goodness it was within return time period returned it. Will not buy this again.
reviews.author: Mon

reviews.title: "Mediocre mower with very cheap materials."
reviews.text: Upon opening the mower I was able to assemble it quickly and easily. After the assembly (which is only folding the handle into upright position and routing the ripcord into the ripcord housing then tighten the bolts) I set out for the 1st day. After I was about half complete the carrier bolts that i had just tightened came loose. I screwed them back together. On my last pass of grass I  made my final turn and the same bolt snapped! I went to lawnmower shop and replaced all the cheap factory bolts with higher quality ones.
reviews.author: Mg

reviews.title: "Review of the Husqvarna 21 inch AWD lawn mower"
reviews.text:
The following is the review the Husqvarna 21inch AWD lawn mower
 
Unpacking the mower was uneventful. Following the directions on top of the box, I had the mower unpacked and in the driveway in under 5 minutes. Unfolding the arm and assembling the grass catcher bag was trivial. Adding the supplied oil was easy, although, I was a little surprised it was a generic and not Briggs Stratton brand. The gas tank has a nice capacity and the opening was large to make filling easy without spilling. The time from unpack to operational mower was under 30 minutes.
 
The mower started with the first pull. There was a lot of smoke, as was mentioned in the manual, but it quickly burned away. The levers controlling the safety shut off and propulsion were easy to work and ergonomically well situated. 
 
The performance of the mower in its mulching capacity was impressive. Although the grass that was cut was not extremely long, the grass clippings were smaller than most mowers I have used and disappeared nicely into the lawn. The self-propulsion lacked the speed resolution that I expected and was a more of a binary on/off. This was the “out of the box” condition and the linkage can perhaps be adjusted better for a more flowing speed control. The AWD option made the slight hills insignificant in the traction of the mower wheels. The mover was run for almost two hours on one tank of gas with some gas still remaining in the tank. I stopped the mower about 10 times and every time it was easily restarted with one pull.

Overall, this mower was easy to get operational, felt well built, and did a great job at cutting the grass. I would recommend this mower to someone who has a large area yard with slight hills.
reviews.author: Yorklynyankee

reviews.title: "Prop Design"
reviews.text: The pulley system is exposed, allowing the drive belts to come off.  The location of the oil dip stick makes it difficult to check the oil level.
reviews.author: Stan

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A"
reviews.text: Purchased on a Thursday , retunred to store on Friday. Worked great for approx 30  minutes, then could not keep it running. Used fresh gas , took approx 2 hours to get it running, then the belt fell off. No protection for the belt under the mower. took it back and purchased a HONDA at HD
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "AWD stopped working immediately."
reviews.text: The AWD stopped working immediately after getting it. Fortunately it is within the first few months of getting it, but I have to take it to a lawn mower repair place to have it fixed. Lowe's will not take the mower back if it has been more than 30 days.
reviews.author: Ryan

reviews.title: "Awful Mower"
reviews.text: Bought this self propelled mower a little over a year ago. Trying to start the mower is at least a 30 minute exercise as the mower continually starts and cuts off. Probably used it about seven times so far and the self propelled mechanism just broke.
reviews.author: lawnboy

reviews.title: "Yikes!"
reviews.text: We have used the mower 3 times. During the 3rd mowing it just sputtered and died. Yes is did have gas and oil. It has been nothing but trouble.
reviews.author: Lawngnome

reviews.title: "Biggest piece of junk ever"
reviews.text: I purchased this lawn mower and used it 5 times. It started having the same problem many others are having. Losing power, starts but then can't be restarted until the next day. It's just generally a poorly designed and built piece of junk. I sent it in to get fixed and they want to charge me $275 to repair it. I only paid $299 to begin with. I have seen many other people complain about having the same problem with the same result. Always a high price to repair. The company obviously does not stand behind their product. The warranty is useless and the extended coverage I purchased is worthless. I have already talked two people out of buying Husqvarna products and will do my best to discourage everyone from buying their worthless junk. I plan to go to Lowes as often as possible and camp out in the lawn tool section and keep as many people as possible from purchasing this garbage.
reviews.author: Brett

reviews.title: "clutch broke after 5 uses"
reviews.text: Bought this mower at Lowes. the clutch failed to engage the wheels after 5 uses.  I has owned the unit for 40 days, 10 days past Lowes 30 day warantee. Lowes would not help on a replacement and sent me to Husquavarna for warantee repairs. Except at this time of year all the waranetee repair centers are 1 1/2 months out on repairs. so I spent $300 for something I now cant use. Wont be buying anything else from Husquavarna or lowes
reviews.author: pat

reviews.title: "Terrible choice"
reviews.text: Only good thing I can say about this mower is that it has plenty of power. Other than that, after plenty repairs,  the carburetor started leaking fuel.Not worth the price. I only had it for three seasons.
reviews.author: Yoyo

reviews.title: "Nothing but problems"
reviews.text: Bought mower , worked great for 6 cuts then took longer and longer and longer to start. Took it back. Lowes said they would repair it.  They did but when I went to pick it up they gave me $110 bill. I told them no way am I paying. They said it was my fault that the carburetor needed cleaned. Hmmmmm. Used the mix they recommended. They forgave the $110.  I put a fuel filter on along with the mix they recommend and had the same problem again a month later. They would not take it back. The mower is extremely loud and vibrated more than anything I've used before. It feels like the blade was never balanced from day 1.  If you need another lawn ornament , then please buy this mower. My 20 year old push mower never had the carburetor cleaned or needed mix in the gas and still fires right up. Good luck with this purchase!
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Broke"
reviews.text: I bought this mower on July 3 2018. And on August 20 2018 it stoped running in the middle of my yard    I tried to restart it and it did run a minute then lost most of its power.     Before I started my lawn I did add gas and check the oil like I do evey time I use it.  So that's not the problem. I called Lowe's where I got it and told me they cannot replace it but will send it out for repair. That I s going to take 3 weeks     So who is mowing my lawn.
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "garbage."
reviews.text: on my 3rd one in under a year maufacturing defects on 1st two and the 3rd replacement just stopped working. I'm tired of taking them back and replacing them. Had a craftsman that lasted 10 years why i switched I'll never know. Stay away from Husqvarna.
reviews.author: jeramie

reviews.title: "Piece of junk"
reviews.text: After only 1 year of minimal use the mower won't start. Have tried everything. Now must take to a repair shop and spend more $$$$.
reviews.author: Thainternut

reviews.text: This is the second Husqvarna we have purchased in past few years.This one was for our daughter's birthday.The reason for buying this particular lawnmower is that it STARTS...every time.Being a small size female,   this is important to both me and our daughter.I heartily recommend this lawnmower.Catherine Parker
reviews.author: Catherine

reviews.title: "GOOD VALUE"
reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use. Very nice packaging.  Appears to be somewhat better quality than my older Troy-Bilt. Not impressed with the Briggs engine vs Honda.  But for the average life span of mowers I don't see paying the significant cost bump. Strongly recommend using Sta-bil to help stave off ethanol created issues.  Height adjusters are flimsy but you won't change height much so just be gentle.  I liked the AWD for my new 16 degree sloped lawn.  Be careful as it will take off on you. Very strong pull. Easy start. Don't bother with electronic start IMHO -- unneeded complexity for a problem that stopped existing with improved pull start systems. I got this model on sale with an added coupon so was well worth the value. Otherwise this is still a good buy.
reviews.author: Tmqn

reviews.title: "Won't start"
reviews.text: This mower is trash. It will not start until I remove the spark plug and spray gas into it.  I have had it for 2 months and am very disappointed.
reviews.author: Nashcrete

reviews.title: "Impressive!"
reviews.text:
From out of the box to actual mowing took about 30 minutes. Well packed and easy to get out of the box if you cut the one end flap. Flip the handle up, lock into position, hook the pull rope up and then simply put in gas and oil. The unit took almost the entire bottle of oil that came with the unit (30 wt). Took 2 pulls to get the unit started. This unit has a lot of wheel power with the 4 wheel drive and moves around easily even up hills. 
The directions are OK but I wish they would separate the English from all the other languages. Makes it hard to find the next step in assembly. One important instruction that needs to be in bold print is about tipping the mower. As many people would do, I tipped the mower over to take a look at the bottom to see the belt drives and how hard it would be to clean. After that, I saw in the manual the comment about NOT tipping the mower when it has a full tank of gas. The plastic mulch plug was a bit deformed out of the box, but I bent it back into shape so it would stay in place. Cuts grass great and seems to have plenty of cutting power. Interesting was the comment about never having to change the oil. Simply add oil when it gets low! I also like the fact that there is no primer bulb or priming required. Cant get any easier than that!
reviews.author: Mark

reviews.title: "motor problems"
reviews.text: I have had one of these for 2 years and this is the list of problems , slight smoke when it sets for a while ,wont restart in hot weather ,carb problems , very poor warranty service they try to blame you or tell you they cant do it under warranty  ,i have a very small area to mow and have experienced all these problems, the drive part has worked great but the motor is junk.
reviews.author: hank

reviews.title: "Worst lawn mower I ever owned"
reviews.text: This mower has only been used about 10 mowings on less than 1/4 acre of grass. I bought it last July, and now it shuts down right after starting. I brought it back to Lowes to either have it repaired under warranty or receive credit towards the purchase of a new mower. Lowes wouldn't do anything and told me that they would send it in for repair at my cost. after being a loyal customer of Lowes for over 15 years I will no longer purchase anything from them and highly suggest that people not buy a Huskvsrna piece of junk.
reviews.author: Eddie

reviews.title: "All-Wheel Drive Easy Start Mower"
reviews.text: This is an interesting piece of machinery. It assembled easily out of the box in less than five minutes.. I added the oil and some clean fuel and it cranked on the first pull. Me and my fellows all gave it a good test run on our very rough wooded yard. The height is very easy to adjust on all four wheels. The wheel size seemed to be just right. I removed the mulching plug and put the mower to use. The rear discharge is neat because it doesn't throw grass or rocks to the side limiting you to mow in one direction. The shoot did stop up a few times when mowing over some tall weeds or piles of leaves. I think it would do the same with wet grass. The bagger works just fine and hangs easily on the rear rack. The all-wheel drive will move you along. It runs at a pretty fast pace requiring some special care when working in tight spots, but it gets the job done on larger areas. The engine power seemed to match the pace and it pushed on through even thick leaf piles. Turning is pretty easy if you release the drive just for a second. My yard is very hilly and I found this mower worked well to power up the hill and then roll backwards on the rear wheels. It continued to crank on one pull for me and my sons. The handle is a pretty comfortable grip with not too much pad. The blade held up well to sticks and nuts under my trees. The tread on the wheels is aggressive enough for every spot I tested it on allowing for single hand mowing over much of my yard. Time will tell if so much open area under the deck with the drive belt and pulleys being exposed will cause issues with clogging and jamming. There are two exposed pulleys that are plastic and much of the diverted under the deck is plastic. The weight of the mower is a consideration if you do not need all wheel drive, but a great aid to traction if you do. I had some debris piling up behind the engine as I mowed, but this may just be due to the volume of leaves I had on this first mowing. I did not use the hose cleaning port this time, but probably will after mowing grass that is damp. I am looking forward to watching my boys mow more and they like the cool look of the mower. It is very easy to start!
reviews.author: Russell

reviews.title: "Horrible Lawn Mower"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower 7/27/2017 and used it 3 times.  The gas tank was empty when it was stored for the winter. Now on 4/22/2018 it won't start.  The spark plug is fine, the air filter is fine, I drained the gas from the gas line and carburetor and replaced with new gas, and cleaned the carburetor (which was already clean) but it will not start. Now I'll have to see if Husqvarna stands by their warranty and take it to a local authorized dealer (which all get bad reviews). Such a hassle. Stay away from this mower!
reviews.author: Ian

reviews.title: "Good Mower And Good Price"
reviews.text: I am mowing my lawn since last 18 years or more. I like this machine the best. The features I liked the most are- All Wheel drive- Rear Discharge of grass clippings. - Easy Start- Extended Handle bar which can be folded Easily
reviews.author: Kiran

reviews.title: "Great lawnmower, would recommend"
reviews.text: I love this lawn mower.  It cuts my grass nicely and is very easy to push.  I have an acre and I have no problems with this mower.  Im a girl and its super easy to push and start.  I would definitely recommend this lawn mower.
reviews.author: DMS529

reviews.title: "Not Tough"
reviews.text: One rock and it bent the cam shaft, the flywheel key did not shear as it is supposed to meaning the whole mower is junk instead of being able to replace a $2 part that is there to prevent bigger damage.
reviews.author: TC

reviews.title: "Disappointing quality and design"
reviews.text: Having great respect for the Husqvarna brand from experience with their motorcycles and chain saws, my initial excitement with this all wheel drive mower soon became a disappointment. After several uses it seemed the drive belt had lost tension because the mower self-propelled speed slowed noticeably. I looked but found, incredibly, that there is no drive belt tension adjustment at all, which is very puzzling. Soon the mower wouldn't self-propel at all on wet grass because the loose drive belt simply slipped on the pulley system. I bought a new belt after several months of use, and couldn't believe the amount of mower disassembly necessary to replace it. I'm an aircraft mechanic, and helicopters are less complex than this poorly designed mower. The engine cuts out on steep hills, and the "variable speed control" was nice for the very short time it lasted.
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "Very pleased"
reviews.text: This joker is a dagum mountain goat. Started first pull for me and is my temporary favorite new toy
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "1 Year Mower"
reviews.text: We had this mower for less than a year and now it starts for a couple of seconds and then dies. We've cleaned the carb (which looks brand new by the way), replaced gas, replaced oil, changed out filters. When the mower works, it's great. But it's sat dead more for us than cut any grass.  Big disappointment! Save yourself the headache and go to a different mower.
reviews.author: Taylor

reviews.title: "Very good especially for the price"
reviews.text: I have owned several lawn mowers in the past but this was my first AWD and it definitely has the pulling power i needed. I have a slight slope that used to be a huge pain with my FWD mower but this mower pulls itself up the hill very easily. Also the adjustment height is higher giving a thicker greener cut. I did a lot of research and for the money this seemed to be the best choice for my budget and so far i am happy with it.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "done with there junk"
reviews.text: 3 months old and the motor in mine is literally blown up.   The all wheel drive is garbage it never wants to disengage.  Stay away from this garbage it's junk.
reviews.author: tbone

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY!!!!!!"
reviews.text: Purchased this mower in 2016. Ran perfectly for the first two mows. After that, the AWD stopped working properly. In May 2019, AWD stopped working completely. Also, about a year after purchase, mower engine started smoking on short declines. Shuts off completely if slightly tilted to the left hand side. Not worth the money.
reviews.author: Teddy

reviews.title: "Don't buy this product"
reviews.text: This mower doesn't have the power to get out of it own way . Using it in the mulch mode causes it to bogg brown and stall when in all wheel drive . My previous Husqvarna had a side exhaust flap which allowed mulch out easy . The LC 221 being a bottom drop mulched clogs every few feet . Don't wast your money on this mower
reviews.author: Scott

reviews.title: "do not buy"
reviews.text: I have had do many issues with this piece of junk, im not sure where to begin. From the beginning, it would not start properly, would back fire everytime i turned it off, the self drive function would stop work whenever it fealt like it and the handle would just fall off weekly. Spend your money on anything else.
reviews.author: Jerr

reviews.title: "All plastic"
reviews.text: everything where the blades goes together is plastic. Grass and small peaces of wood or anything else catches on the plastic and around it. If you have a small yard that the grass doesn't grow very fast or tall then I would buy it. But would not use for big yards or tall grass.
reviews.author: Baileyone79

reviews.title: "Best Mower I've Ever Owned"
reviews.text: This mower is 2 years old now and absolutely amazing! Starts first pull and cuts like a powerhouse! The negative reviews are because people use cheap ethanol gas and let it sit around! If they would buy non ethanol gas and start the mower once a week every week even in the winter months rather then let it sit they would never have any issues! If you let your car sit around for months without starting it up guarantee by the time you finally went to use it, it would not start or run right either! Engines can't just sit they need to be run whether you plan on using them or not plain and simple! Is it really that much effort to pull a cord once a week and let it run for 5 minutes? Those 5 minutes once a week will save you a lot in repair bills and problems!
reviews.author: Gardenway

reviews.title: "Horrible"
reviews.text: Had one for a house in NY. Bought another one for house in SC.  It didn't work right from the time we got it, but time was tight and we didn't have time to return it.  Went back to NY and will be returning to SC now and will see what Lowes will do for us.  It's 4 months old.  Does not start until about 6 pulls, does not self propel and sounds like it's going to stall. Gas is good so that's not the issue.
reviews.author: tfg

reviews.title: "Very pleased"
reviews.text: This joker is a dagum mountain goat. Started first pull for me and is my temporary favorite new toy
reviews.author: Nick

reviews.title: "1 Year Mower"
reviews.text: We had this mower for less than a year and now it starts for a couple of seconds and then dies. We've cleaned the carb (which looks brand new by the way), replaced gas, replaced oil, changed out filters. When the mower works, it's great. But it's sat dead more for us than cut any grass.  Big disappointment! Save yourself the headache and go to a different mower.
reviews.author: Taylor

reviews.title: "Very good especially for the price"
reviews.text: I have owned several lawn mowers in the past but this was my first AWD and it definitely has the pulling power i needed. I have a slight slope that used to be a huge pain with my FWD mower but this mower pulls itself up the hill very easily. Also the adjustment height is higher giving a thicker greener cut. I did a lot of research and for the money this seemed to be the best choice for my budget and so far i am happy with it.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "done with there junk"
reviews.text: 3 months old and the motor in mine is literally blown up.   The all wheel drive is garbage it never wants to disengage.  Stay away from this garbage it's junk.
reviews.author: tbone

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY!!!!!!"
reviews.text: Purchased this mower in 2016. Ran perfectly for the first two mows. After that, the AWD stopped working properly. In May 2019, AWD stopped working completely. Also, about a year after purchase, mower engine started smoking on short declines. Shuts off completely if slightly tilted to the left hand side. Not worth the money.
reviews.author: Teddy

reviews.title: "Don't buy this product"
reviews.text: This mower doesn't have the power to get out of it own way . Using it in the mulch mode causes it to bogg brown and stall when in all wheel drive . My previous Husqvarna had a side exhaust flap which allowed mulch out easy . The LC 221 being a bottom drop mulched clogs every few feet . Don't wast your money on this mower
reviews.author: Scott

reviews.title: "do not buy"
reviews.text: I have had do many issues with this piece of junk, im not sure where to begin. From the beginning, it would not start properly, would back fire everytime i turned it off, the self drive function would stop work whenever it fealt like it and the handle would just fall off weekly. Spend your money on anything else.
reviews.author: Jerr

reviews.title: "All plastic"
reviews.text: everything where the blades goes together is plastic. Grass and small peaces of wood or anything else catches on the plastic and around it. If you have a small yard that the grass doesn't grow very fast or tall then I would buy it. But would not use for big yards or tall grass.
reviews.author: Baileyone79

reviews.title: "Best Mower I've Ever Owned"
reviews.text: This mower is 2 years old now and absolutely amazing! Starts first pull and cuts like a powerhouse! The negative reviews are because people use cheap ethanol gas and let it sit around! If they would buy non ethanol gas and start the mower once a week every week even in the winter months rather then let it sit they would never have any issues! If you let your car sit around for months without starting it up guarantee by the time you finally went to use it, it would not start or run right either! Engines can't just sit they need to be run whether you plan on using them or not plain and simple! Is it really that much effort to pull a cord once a week and let it run for 5 minutes? Those 5 minutes once a week will save you a lot in repair bills and problems!
reviews.author: Gardenway

reviews.title: "Horrible"
reviews.text: Had one for a house in NY. Bought another one for house in SC.  It didn't work right from the time we got it, but time was tight and we didn't have time to return it.  Went back to NY and will be returning to SC now and will see what Lowes will do for us.  It's 4 months old.  Does not start until about 6 pulls, does not self propel and sounds like it's going to stall. Gas is good so that's not the issue.
reviews.author: tfg

reviews.title: "Zero stars wan't available."
reviews.text: I bought a Husqvarna Lc221A 163cc 21-in Self-Propelled All-Wheel Drive Residential Gas Lawn Mower Mulching Capable Model  961 45 00-35  on 04/29/2017. I was excited, my first Husqvarna. I bought is specifically to mow the grass under my bushes.I get home start using it, the first thing I notice, is the front clutch did not automatically disengage when I released the bar. I had to push the mower forward a little bit to get the clutch to disengage. I could live with that. Then as I was pushing the mower under the bushes to cut the grass, the gas cap would periodically pop off. I could live with that. Last week, the nut that holds the handle to the mower deck popped off. Therefore, I bought a new nylon lock one today and fixed it. I could live with that.After fixing my brand new Husqvarna, I take it out and start mowing under the bushes. I get under the first one and I hear a crunch and see plastic in the lawn.  I investigate and it is the gas cap. It popped off again while mowing under the bush and was run over. After buying the mower to get under the bushes, it was not even good for that.Maybe if I had a lawn without bushes, I would have a different opinion. That is not the case. It will be a LONG time before I even consider look at a Husqvarna ANYTHING again. I will be at Lowes soon to return it, minus a gas cap and with a non-standard lock nut on it.
reviews.author: ClarksvilleCouple

reviews.title: "Worst Lawn Mower I Ever Owned"
reviews.text: I've owned it for 2 years and it's impossible to start and keep running.  Runs rough.  Terrible lawn mower.  It's my first time buying Husqvarna and will never again.  I'm dumping this and finally going electric.
reviews.author: Jack

reviews.title: "No Compression"
reviews.text: Only used the mower about one year. Then would not start. I replaced/cleaned everything spark and fuel related....finally tested the engine and it had no compression (means it's shot!). Had a Honda engine from a previous mower that had the deck rust out and wheels fall off (got 10 years from that mower)...kept the Honda engine and put it on the husky to mow...but they are not identical and I lost my self propelled....really bad in hot Florida with a big yard. Honda>Briggs and Stratton. A shame how many of these I see with briggs issues.
reviews.author: Jay m

reviews.title: "AWD is the way to go!"
reviews.text: Set up was easy it took me about 30 min but that was because I took my time. Once I got the deck height just right this mower was a beast! It cut tall thick damp grass like nothing and the all wheel drive is strong enough to pull you up hills. I ran it without the bag and I noticed it got clogged a few times but this was my first cut of the season and the grass was tall and patchy. I cut just under a half acre and only used about half a tank of gas which I thought was good for how powerful this motor is. Overall this is a great mower!
reviews.author: JD

reviews.title: "not for florida"
reviews.text: Junk for Florida lawns.  This mower can't keep up with one weeks growth.  It bogs down constantly, and it's 4 wheel drive is garbage.  I have to fight with it every time I use it, and I keep it clean and well maintained.  Look elsewhere.
reviews.author: Castle

reviews.title: "3 mowers in 5 years"
reviews.text: I'm not sure if this is the particular model, but a word of caution to would-be buyers: I've bought three Husqvarna AWL mowers in 5 years and as of this morning, the third one died and per my small engine repairman, has to be scrapped.  That's terrible quality and durability.  I'm a homeowner, so together with mowing my neighbor's 1/2 acre yard, I only mow two yards in a year in NC for about 6 months.  Each mower's engine failed in a different way, so there seems to be no rhyme or reason.  New, they start out great, mulching or picking up with a bagger everything they should.  But they just don't hold up.  $400 x3= $1200 in five years.  Buy one if you want, but go ahead and start looking atbthe next one you'll have to buy when the Husqvarna craps out.
reviews.author: lawnlover

reviews.title: "mower sucks"
reviews.text: I bought it last year used it for the season and i go to get it ready to cut and it will not start i changed the spark plug fresh gas and nothing terrible mower
reviews.author: bj

reviews.title: "Great replacement for mower I loved"
reviews.text: I bought this mower in April /May 2017 after a neighbor boasted about the quality of this mower.  I thought my 15 year old lawnboy was going to die midway through a mowing and the new Lawnboys dont have the same engine or deck (new Lawnboy models are poor quality and have so so reviews.  I have used this mower for 10 or so times and have no negatives.  I walk fast and the speed is great, deck and bag are solid. One pull starts as advertised.  Already used it once this year.  One pull start no priming simply a fresh tank of gas.
reviews.author: Gary

reviews.title: "5 stars down to 2 for start issue"
reviews.text: This is the start of 3rd season of use. My observations:1. Mower performed well 1st 2 summers (short seasons in Maine). Cut well, started right up. Downside is air filter gets dirty fast due to large opening at bottom of cover. I added a piece of soft foam around the bottom half of the filter to reduce debris from clogging airfilter prematurely.2. After 2nd winter storage( gas removed), mower would start and only run for a few seconds then quit. Have always used fresh gas ( only E10 regular gas available here). Changing gas no help. Finally removed black plastic carburetor cover( 4 screws) then cleaned and lubricated butterfly valve and associated fittings. It had been sticking which seems to have caused short run time. Hopefully this was one time event. Ran mower normally for 45minutes.Also, is there a downside risk using 91 octane gas?  All 87 octane regular gas sold here has ethanol, but some stations sell ethanol-free 91 octane.
reviews.author: Dan

reviews.title: "excellent mower"
reviews.text: bought this mower a month ago, waited to review until I used it several times.  very easy & fast set up out of the box, and started on the first pull.  Ample power to mow going up inclines in my yard. Actually enjoy mowing with this. I never use grass catchers, so can't comment on that part.  I'm totally pleased with this purchase.
reviews.author: TBone

reviews.title: "Great so far!"
reviews.text: I purchased this lawn mower right at a year ago and have had zero issues. I have a single lot lawn that I mow so its pretty standard amount to mow for a non commercial mower I presume. Anyways I have never had an issue with the mower bogging down or dying on me when operating except when I get too aggressive mowing grass that's over 8 inches tall and super thick blade stuff that I wouldn't expect any non commercial mower to handle. The self-propelled operation in my opinion is very handy, its not just an on and off operation and you can "feather" the self-propelled operation to match the speed you are walking. Also if you want to go backwards with the mower all you have to do is take a step forward after releasing the lever and it disengages and it freely moves like a non propelled mower. The engine does have an interesting sound to me, I thought at first I did not add enough oil since the engine sounded more of a metallic that any other mower I have used but everything checked out and it has always ran just fine picking up clippings correctly and never sputtering. The engine is said to be maintenance free with no need to change the oil but I still changed the oil this year to be safe. I think the most impressive thing for me was the fact that I had the mower stored in my garage over winter so roughly 5 months of no operating and I pulled on the lawnmower 1 time and amazingly it started right up. I will note that I use at least 89 octane 100% gas in it at all times and I did use a fuel stabilizer for storage.
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "Easy start"
reviews.text: Old lawn mower was getting hard to start, right now I'm not able to start mower due to medical issues, so was looking for a mower that my wife could start easily. Got this home, filled up with gas and oil and on second easy pull it started for me, then the wife came home and I surprised her with it, she pulled the string one time and it started for her, she couldn't believe it started so easily. She was really impressed with the new mower, now she wants to cut the lawn all of time now> Thanks for a great mower!!
reviews.author: Wrench

reviews.title: "Husqvarna Gas Lawn Mowers"
reviews.text: This is the easiest starting lawnmower I ever owned and the first one I never had to sweep behind.
reviews.author: SweetT

reviews.title: "run run run away"
reviews.text: this mower is a real nice item cuts really good cleans up nice and speeds the job up.i give it a 4 star for two reasons. number one as a disabled person the one speed all wheel drive beats the crap out of me. a younger more able-bodied person could use this to their advantage. and number two. every mower i have had since i lived at my current address has done the complete job with one full tank of fuel, this one i have to add fuel a second time to finish the job so a larger fuel tank sould have been used.
reviews.author: benuts

reviews.title: "So far so great"
reviews.text: I might have gone with 4.5 stars instead of of 5 but since I can't, I'll go all 5 because I'm really pleased so far. I've mowed my sloping uneven 1 acres 3 times so far and this mower has kept up with me.  First, I'm hard on lawn/outdoor equipment, so only the tough survive my hands. Not only is the slope a challenge, my yard is surrounded by thorny bramble that I pushed back last year. I don't wish to push it back this year so I'm mowing over that area; sticks, very small stumps, tall weeds. This mower is taking it all. My singular complaint was at start up. If I cut the motor, twice it took 10 minutes before it would start again. I haven't had that problem since the first cut, front and back yard. I'm pleased so far. It's a good even cut, the awd has plenty of pep getting up and down my hill, it's easy to maneuver. To adjust the wheels, each one has to be raised or lower, I wish that were front/back but that's small. I have not used the bag and probably won't. All in all, I'd recommend. If that changes I'll be back.
reviews.author: Kat

reviews.title: "Best walk behind mower ever!!!"
reviews.text: I have never had an all wheel drive walk behind mower until now. I don't know how we ever survived without one! This mower is the easiest thing to use. It doesn't spin tires or get stuck like the front wheel or rear wheel drive ones do!!! Wish I had bought it sooner!!!
reviews.author: David

reviews.title: "Not all that I believed it to be"
reviews.text: First of all, I found it difficult to determine the cutting height .... nowhere in the manual (I'll get to that too) does it tell you how to adjust the wheels for a specific cutting height. Secondly, both my son and I had difficulty adjusting the speed to match out pace. Thirdly, it was difficult to attach the hose and nowhere does it tell you how long it takes to clean the deck. Finally, there was NO manual included that can tell you anything useful ... even the website is difficult to use. Good luck!
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Glad I chose this mower"
reviews.text: When they say "self-propelled"--they mean it !! This mower drug me all over the yard--got the job done in half the time it usually takes...and provided entertainment for the neighbors who were sitting in the adjacent yard. Make sure you wear good shoes that lace up--not slip-ons,.I am pleased with this mower and glad that I chose this one over another Troy-Built. The manuals could be better-had to come to the website to find out what the blue nozzle on the deck as for( a water hose to clean the deck).
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Mowing is now easy!"
reviews.text: All wheel drive mower has made mowing my big hill as easy as the flat areas of my yard. I really  like  the  variable  speed  control. You  are  able  to  set your  own  pace. Put the fun back in mowing  the  lawn. Oh yeah, it also starts on the first pull!
reviews.author: Silverback

reviews.text: I took it out of the box was very easy to put together put oil and gas in and it started on the first pull the self propel works great and easy this is the first new mower I purchased I would recommend this mower and the 3 year warranty is great deal
reviews.author: flexster

reviews.title: "Fantastic! Superb Self-Propelled AWD mower!"
reviews.text: I'm a stickler for comparing and after quite a bit of research. At $339, this is a great value! I did a bit better only becuase another Lowes customer returned theirs after one use and decided to buy a rider for their larger lawn. I stood by and then told the Lowes clerk I would like to purchase it since they usually put these used ones out in front at a discount. I had to to wait for it to be serviced per Lowes policy, which was fine. The marked it down to $271.00 so I saved a bit on a one-time used Huqvarna which I have since been delighted with. I've been mowing my own lawn since 1975 and this is by far the best mower I have had yet. Easy to start, spectacular on hills and around obstacles, and I love the Howe-mounted deck cleaning option. A TIP on that: I bought from lowes the Quick-Connect metal hose attachment couplers making it literally a snap to connect and disconnect the hose to the mower, instead of always having to spin on the plastic connector.Summary: I'd buy this again in a heartbeat at both higher and lower priced mowers.
reviews.author: Den

reviews.title: "Great AWD lawnmower"
reviews.text: This was a great upgrade for me from a 20 year old push mower. AWD is awesome. This mower goes pretty fast.This mower starts on 1st or 2nd pull. I have not used bag yet as I usually only mulch. This mower really munched clippings very well. I don't see any clumps left behind. This mower has the Briggs engine which was also on my last mower and that one was still running after 20 years. Overall I'm glad I chose this mower.
reviews.author: FloridaCheesehead

reviews.title: "Just Awful"
reviews.text: My husband and I have had nothing but trouble from our Husqvarna self-propelled push mower(s) since we bought the first one in March of this year. The first two we bought fell within the Lowes 30 day return policy, but the third one just messed up today and, of course, it's one week past our 30 day purchase date. I don't know if it's a design flaw or what, but the self-propell function on these Husqvarna mowers are a disgrace. Needless to say, my husband and I are not happy customers right now.
reviews.author: Unhappy

reviews.title: "Died after 20 minutes"
reviews.text: I did everything according to the instruction manual, and it mowed like a champ for 20 minutes. The AWD was great.  20 minutes in, the engine sputtered, and died. Would not restart.  Very frustrated.
reviews.author: BCM21128

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A is a piece of garbage"
reviews.text: I try to scalp my lawn but could not finish with this brand new mower. I set my cut size to level 2 which only cut 1 inch of dead Bermuda grass, the engine would choke up and die. Wasted my time to clean it out and return it. I would not recommend this mower unless you plan on only cutting short and green grass and many trip to empty the bag.
reviews.author: TheHandyGuy

reviews.title: "Parts no longer available?????"
reviews.text: Do not buy this lawn mower...  I have a regular size yard, never let grass get to high or thick.  The self propel cable and other cable are no longer in stock.  The self drive cable somehow got stretched out.  Poor quality
reviews.author: steven

reviews.title: "95% like"
reviews.text: Starting my second summer using this mower, wanted to use it for a while before I reviewed it, to be fair. 2 complaints, one minor, which I'll list first. The gas cap will not stay on. Mowing around and under shrubs or bushes knocks it off almost every time. It needs to be actually threaded, not a "bayonet type" lock. Second, for me it's not fast enough. On flat, level surfaces, which is 90% of my yard, I have to slow my walking, although I'm 63 years old. Maybe 10-15% faster would be ideal.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: After buying a battery mower and being let down over the last season and half I decided to upgrade. I did a lot of research and I could f be happier. Out of the box had it assembled in matter of minutes. Started first pull, and 6 (3 front 3 back yard) cuts with multiple starts during each cut, it still starts on first pull. The self propelled option helps cut time down especially because my yard has hills. It bags 100 times better than my last mower also. I would recommend this mower any day
reviews.author: Gerald

reviews.title: "Very good product, I bought one and it works great"
reviews.text: I bought one from Lowes in Danville, Va. The company said it was very easy to start. Sure enough it cranked on the first pull of the rope and it cuts great. Very good product. I would recommend to anyone
reviews.author: Danny
