reviews.title: "Self-propelled cable flaw - defective"
reviews.text: I've owned this model of the Husqvarna mower for 3 years. Mower runs great and always starts on the first pull. I'm only giving a 2 star rating since the self-propelled cable has snapped 4 times on me in 3 years of owning. My yard is small (.20 acres) and flat. I'm disappointed in the poor design of the cable and lack of quality. It is expensive to have a small-engine repair service replace the cable every time this happens. Other than the cable issue, this is a good mower. Buyer beware.
reviews.author: Gogetr75

reviews.title: "Best push mower I've owned"
reviews.text: I own a Lawn Maintenance business and this push mower is by far the best I've ever purchased. Starts first time EVERY time and is durable, reliable, and I highly recommend it. Thank you Husqvarna
reviews.author: Mason

reviews.title: "False Advertising"
reviews.text: Bought a Husqvarna lawn mower from Lowes thinking Lowes and Husqvarna will stand behind their products if anything shall go wrong. The mower is not even a year old and the AWD went out on it. Lowes AND Husqvarna refuse to stand behind their names and replace/repair their product even though they sell it stating “3 year worry free warranty”. Complete disappointment in both big name companies. Will definitely not return and do busses with either. Absolutely unacceptable for the customer!
reviews.author: John

reviews.title: "gas stabilizer"
reviews.text: This all wheel drive mower is the best I ever bought, Just one advice do not use gas stabilizer with your gas. It tell you this in the manual. The second year had to bring it to Lowers and had to pay to have it clean. So now I only use Non-ethanol gas. this is my 4th year with this mower and runs like a charm, start on the first pull every time. Also, you have to adjust the speed it goes very fast I got mine on very low and I walk behind it using one hand. Gets yours today at Lowes
reviews.author: charles

reviews.title: "Great product!"
reviews.text: Bought this mower a few weeks ago. Assembly was easy, started on the 1st pull. Self propelled system AWD is awesome! What a difference from my previous FWD....
reviews.author: Marcos

reviews.title: "i expected more from huskey."
reviews.text: I give it two stars because it is a brigs.starts plenty of power.the design of self propel has a lot to be desired.if you have a gum tree don't buy.I to pull it apart every time I use it because gum balls jam the drive belt.It has a good warranty but when I asked the pros at lowes the said I should have bought ext warranty.its less than 6 mounths old.NO more lowes no more huskey for me.
reviews.author: whitey

reviews.title: "Engine is faulty"
reviews.text: The Briggs engine went out after about one year. I replaced spark plug, cleaned carb, etc...finally a friend who works on small engines took a look and said it had no compression. This means it's a paper weight. Put a Honda on it I had left over from a 12 year old craftsman that the deck rusted out...Honda started and mowed!The self propel feature is now useless and I have to push a 1.5 year old mower through st augustine grass all summer in Florida. My advice, get a Honda.
reviews.author: Jay

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: This  lasted just three years, the self propelled broke and the gears , it wasnt worth fixing. It was junk never buy another one.
reviews.author: bandit

reviews.title: "Not so much"
reviews.text: In spring of 2018, I needed a new lawn mower and thought I would purchase a nice one that would last instead of the cheapest one like I usually buy, so I went to Lowes and decided to buy a Husqvarna.  Fast forward to spring 2019, it was time to get the lawn mower out for the first mowing of the year.  I was disappointed to find that my mower wouldn't start, and no I didn't leave any gas in it and I only use ethanol free gas.  I was forced to put my 1 year old mower in the shop for repair.  When I picked it up from the shop, I got some very disappointing news.  First, it wouldn't start because my coil had gone bad, so they replaced it.  Secondly, they said the mower had the wrong blade on it.  My mower had a blade with a 5 point star shaped connection hole on it, and they replaced it with a blade with a circle connection hole on it.  So my 1 year old lawn mower that I paid $349 for at Lowes cost me $129 in repairs the first year I owned it.  I am very disappointed with Husqvarna and definitely have buyer's remorse on this purchase.  Additionally, when I contacted Husqvarna about the problem, they said the blade issue was impossible, that the parts were not interchangeable.
reviews.author: Jan

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: This mower is great. We have a small hill we mow. This self propelled mower makes it so much easier.
reviews.author: Lc

reviews.title: "4 1/2 star would have been closer"
reviews.text: First of all, I am not a professional. I am a regular guy who likes to keep a well cut, weed free lawn. However my yard wont be in any magazines in the near future. With that said this is a really nice mower that is well above average. Briggs & Stratton has appropriately named the engine “Easy Start” & I would completely agree. The AWD is impressive. I saw an online debate on whether or not it makes much difference. Let me settle that: there is no debate. This mower pulls... period. It WANTS to go forward & the top speed is a brisk walk. The only drawback I have noticed after the initial cut is that grass collects on the deck behind the engine when using the rear discharge. The life of an air cooled engine is... getting fresh air & there is air vented onto the back of the engine, however grass clippings slowly but surely escape through this vent & build up on the deck. The engineer in me wants correct this, but I am convinced this vent & the air moving through it is also engineered & likely very important. So it will require reaching down every so often & removing the grass. As with anything, only time & usage will yield a valid review but my first impression is very good just not quite a 5 star.
reviews.author: Jason

reviews.title: "5 WEEKS TO REPAIR????"
reviews.text: I took my 4 month old Husky back to LOWES for repair, the drive cable let loos..I was told, they don't help with repairs, just be on your way. I found a local AUTHORIZED DEALER. The mower is at week 5 and I was told possibly today for repairs to be done.  I love the mower, works great, when it works..Ive paid more for someone else to mow my lawn while waiting to be repaired that I should have bought a more expensive, better built mower from a dependable manufacture.
reviews.author: ElCidDad

reviews.title: "Disappointment"
reviews.text: I bought this mower over 3 years ago to replace a Murray that I had for years. The deck was showing rust.  I bought it based on the solid reputation of Husqvarna and I liked the all wheel drive system for my hilly yard.  The first year I was well pleased.  However, last fall the all wheel drive system stopped working.  I took it to an authorized husqvarna repair shop and the following was replaced: idler pulley assembly (metal flange broken which caused the assembly and belt to hang down onto blade spindle), pulleys (2 of the 3 were cracked), a new belt and blade.  When I got it home, it ran well.   2 months ago, the all wheel drive system stopped working again.  I took it to a different authorized shop and they replaced the cable and front pulley.  They indicated the belt looked burned and recommended a new one.  Great, 2 belts in less then a year.  While cutting my yard yesterday, you guessed it, the all wheel drive system died again.  I checked and everything replaced was in tact.  It must be something else. It now sets by the road with a "FREE " sign on it.   I am very disappointed in this Husqvarna product.  Headed out to by a new mower and differently not a husqvarna.  Wish I still had my rusty Murray.
reviews.author: Bama

reviews.title: "I've only run it twice"
reviews.text: It's a lawn mower.  This reviews it's only for sweepstakes entry.
reviews.author: Douglas

reviews.title: "Nice Even Cut"
reviews.text: Extremely pleased, nice even cut and excellent power.
reviews.author: david

reviews.title: "Not for all Yards"
reviews.text: I was initially impressed with this mower. I had only bought Honda/ Troybilt mowers. Husqvarna has lots of nice features and cuts cleanly. It didn't always start on the first pull, when new and the gas cap tended to fall off if you brushed it against shrubs ( I tied it to the body of the mower with string). The LC 221A model gradually lost speed, while in self propelled mode. The hand cable had started to unravel. Then the self propelled feature quit totally. It seems that their drive belts are not protected from any yard debris. Pine cones, prickly gumballs, pine needles or small stones will slowly destroy the exposed drive belts. Unless you live on a golf course or have no neighbors with trees that produce gumballs or pine cones, skip this one. I am having it repaired and giving it away. It has failed after less than one year.
reviews.author: Vinson

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Paul

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Semperfi

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: I have to wright this review since so many out there helped me by reading their reviews. First off I'll say I'm 6 foot, 240. Size does matter when it comes to pushing and controlling these things. That said, this mower was purchased because my wife had so many issues when she would cut the lawn with our old second hand mower. I'll start off by unboxing and assembly. Easy enough. Lifted out of the box, unfolded the handle and tightened. pulled back the start cord and secured in place. Added the included oil, a little gas and it was off to the races. So far after 2 months of use it starts if not with the first pull the second. A few times after a week of sitting in the shed it didn't start until the second pull. My wife does not have any issues starting it. She's about 5'4" and her upper body strength isn't great, so if she can start it. I think most can. The presences handle is comfortable. Overall grip is comfortable. It doesn't have that Z grip that the old mower had. I hate those things. They are set up for a 14 year old boy. Way to close a grip for an adult. This one is nice and easy to hold. Adjusting the cut height is ease enough. Does not have markings in inch's. Just a simple adjustment. There is no prime bulb. You just pull once you grip the handle and the presences handle together. The handle that engages the wheels is comfortable for me. It has a progressive system. When you hold the handle fully to the mower handle it's full speed. My stride is about 29 inch's. In a straight path I have the system fully engaged and the walk is not a slow walk but a comfortable quick walk. I am 60 and have had issues with my legs not wanting to work in the past. I don't have issues with the speed and like it for the exercise and strengthening of my legs. So far no issues here. Back to my wife. The top speed is a little quick for her, and this is the con on this mower. Since she is a small person her hands are small also. She has trouble gripping the lever to engage the drive system. It's a progressive system and her hands are not big enough to control it at the slower speeds. This is where fatigue in her hands kicks in. She never really has a comfortable grip on the handle for the slower speeds. So if your hands are small you may have issues here. I don't have a problem so, so far No issues. I didn't think that AWD system was needed, but it does make a difference. I can't say enough about how I like this mower. It mulches fine. It came with a grass catcher. I mulch so mulching was important to me. So far not seeing big clumps of grass anywhere. I move at least once a week unless we got lots of ran or when we are putting stuff down on the lawn to make the grass grow faster. For the price this does a great job. Time will tell how it holds up. Much is care of the machine to make it last. That I plan on doing. Nope this does not stay running and disengage the blades whale you pick things up. It's an easy pull to start back up again. I figure I can live without that feature. A friend just picked up a mower that does that but he paid twice as much. I think I can live with out that. I wish I could talk about the bagging system but I don't use that. I would rather mulch and put grass back into the ground then add to a dump site. I'll end this with saying It's a great mower.
reviews.author: Dano

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: Don't buy this junk mower, we have only owned it for less than a year and now will not start at all. Would set this piece of junk on fire if we didn't spend so much money on it.
reviews.author: Me

reviews.title: "Strong start sank quickly"
reviews.text: 1 year in, already having issues. even with all the routine maintenance on time this thing isn't going to last. You can tell the parts are cheap. parts fall off in the yard as you mow.
reviews.author: jharris

reviews.title: "Plastic carburetor is a piece of crap."
reviews.text: Unfortunately, the plastic carb is trash.  Read about briggs and stratton plastic carburetor on line.  I have spent more time cleaning? A new carb. Why??  Use fresh gas and store in side, still have probs.  Wish I could retrofit an old carb on this machine.  I think it would be great.  Very disappointing.
reviews.author: Tim

reviews.title: "Awesome mower at a GREAT price!"
reviews.text: Just picked it up today. Once we got home we unloaded it filled it with oil and gas and put it right to work. It seems to be a well constructed mower and im very pleased with the features that it offers at a great price. You could spend more money for a competitor mower with the same features but there is no need. This is an AWESOME mower at a GREAT Price. My only gripe is it could use a few more horsepower but over all its great!
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Design Flaws"
reviews.text: I purchased this and have used it only once so far, and I plan to return it today for something else...I had no issues with the quality and evenness of the cut. The self propel is quite fast so if you're not cutting larger denser areas, you can work very quickly, though since it's a single speed, this can be a con for some. Easy assembly. You pull it out of the box, and attach the handle.The design of the self propel handle is poorly thought out and/or not tested by someone who will be using the thing for more than a few minutes at a time. The handle is entirely too long and I don't have tiny hands either. More often than not, you're only running it around half speed because it's so fast, which means your hand is always in an adjusting gripping motion causing fatigue and discomfort. Additionally, the angle at which you have to hold the self propel handle caused a lot of wrist pain by the time I finished the job. Instead of just holding your arms out in front of you and holding the handle, you have to hold them in front of you, AND THEN bend your hands downwards to reach the handle. Also, I ended up pinching my fingers multiple times with the handle itself. It's just not comfortable to use for more than a few minutes at a time, and my yard takes 40 minutes. This dropped it to 2 stars for me. From an ergonomic standpoint, it's not a good product at all. The whole point of a lawnmower is to be able to use it, and people aren't buying self propelled gas mowers for tiny yards. It needs to be comfortable to use for a long enough period of time.
reviews.author: Russ

reviews.title: "Don't waste your $$"
reviews.text: Bought this mower because I have hip problems, thought AWD would be great. First mow was great. Second n each time after, the AWD system will NOT disengage making it IMPOSSIBLE to back up. Meaning the drive wheels keep driving. So if you only have to go straight, but it. If you have corners, fences or any other obstacle that you need to back up, DON'T WASTE your $$$. Mine is out front for sale for $100.00. Pure junk
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Excellant Mower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower last year, forgot and ran over a small stump with such force I cracked the block. I was so mad because this should have been the last mower I should have to buy( yes, getting a little older now). I was so happy with the performance with this one over all the other mowers I purchased over the years, I promptly went out and got another one without a second thought. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "2 things to be aware of before purchasing"
reviews.text: 1. The mower has a very long push bar. 2. The mower is difficult to pull back especially on an incline.It has a lot of power moving forward which is nice.We've only used it once so it's hard to provide more information than this brief statement.
reviews.author: Forest

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: I've had this mower almost 2 years. It's a beast. Some areas have a semi steep slope and the AWD takes over with ease. Getting the correct deck height setting is a must to provide a beautiful manicured lawn using the grass catcher. Sometimes forward speed has to be reduced with high or thick grass in order for the grass catcher to maintain its efficiency. I would buy another one.  Very satisfied customer.
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Working"
reviews.text: So Far we used this mower on my lawn twice since I've bought it and it has been working really well. Love the hose port to wash the mowers deck afterwards. My yard is mostly hills and the 4 wheel drive has been tackling the hills very well.
reviews.author: Stewy

reviews.title: "lemon?"
reviews.text: It was new, it stopped and would not allow the pulling rope out, stuck. Dealer was helpfull, they took it all apart, could not find anything wrong, but it was fixed,  2 weeks later same thing,dealer fixed, but still did not know why. Now that I moved away from where I bought it it pulls but only runs a second and stops, fuel starved I guess ?  I will attempt fixing myself. When it does run it was good
reviews.author: jimjam

reviews.title: "Belt Cover Design"
reviews.text: The belt cover design is poor. Too much grass gets into the pulleys and belt. I've had the mower about 6 months and have to remove both the front and rear drive mechanism covers twice now to clean out the accumulated grass clogging the drive pulleys. The belt cover should cover more of the pulleys and belt area. I do not let my lawn get high and do not cut it very short, but this mower has issues.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Disappointed"
reviews.text: Belt broke on second use and it's a nightmare finding the correct replacement. I work on cars and small engines and this is one of the most undesirable mower set up I have seen. WAY too many parts to remove just to get to the belt. Also, this is my second one as the first one I bought stopped working on first attempt. Had to return. Should have taken my money back and learned my lesson there.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Best buy I ever made"
reviews.text:
I have had this machine for over a month and I love it.  MY knees and hips are
very thankful also.  The variable walking speed is just what I needed with bad
joints.  When they say starts with the first pull it's true and it wont pull your are
out of the socket doing it.. The ball bearing wheels make moving  the machine
around manually very easy.  I am extremely happy with this purchase.
reviews.author: Richie

reviews.title: "Lousy grass bag and parts"
reviews.text: Noticed this past spring that the grass bag was wearing where the rear door rubs against the bag frame, I've been trying to find ANYBODY who carries a replacement with zero luck. Thanks to ducttape I can still use the bagger this fall. Also this spring the washout port actually broke off while I was cleaning the underside. Again I'm unable to find anybody or parts. Lousy. Never again.
reviews.author: JohnF219

reviews.title: "Don't waste your money!"
reviews.text: Bought this mower from Lowe's 4 years ago. Within first 2 months had issues with the carburetor. Of course took it to an authorized dealer for repair and needed a new carburetor, Lowes would not help at all. Currently it's not working and repair shop said it would require a new Carburetor and fuel filter again. I'm done!! not putting another dime into the product, worst mower ever.
reviews.author: Rhough

reviews.title: "Best mower I've owned so far!"
reviews.text: This has been the best mower I have owned in all my years of mowers. My yard is hilly and the grass is deep. My two wheel drive mower had to be pushed to help it up the incline of my yard, this AWD goes up the inclines with ease, I just pull the handle and walk behind it. It has great reserve power whenever its needed. It was much faster than I cared for so I put a spacer the drive bar so it doesn't engage as far as before and the speed is much better now. What I've also noticed is how light weight this mower feels. It is very easy to maneuver, I have rocks, trees and landscaping to drive around and its so easy to change direction. I've had zero issues with my mower with the exception it was tight for the first two or three starts. It has since loosened up due to breaking in as is normal. Final words, this is a great mower and I am happy with my purchase. Thank you Husqvarna for a great durable product.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "No Speed Control"
reviews.text: I purchased this Mower two Year's ago.It has one Speed,Fast.For the Money that I paid for this Mower,Can they please add Speed control for the Mower speed? The first Year I had nothing but problems and had to bring it in for not being able to start.Now it Starts right up and is dragging me all through the Yard.Husqvarna has cheapened their Products with Plastic like all the rest.
reviews.author: Buster

reviews.title: "Having issues with this mower"
reviews.text: Have had this mower for about 6 months and am bringing it back for repairs for the second time. Pull cord broke first time, second time 4 wheel drive stopped working while mowing, shut down mower to inspect, tried to restart and pull cord broke, AGAIN. this is begining to be one of the worst mowers I have ever owned. When it works, the mowers is great. The key word there is WHEN.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Good for 3 years only"
reviews.text: I've had this mowers less than 4 years and had to take it in for repair twice.  I've now spent nearly as much in repair as the original price.  This last time I only got one good mow before it wouldn't start again.  Problem with the carburetor design that it's too succeptible to getting dirty then it won't start.   I'm just going to have to buy a new mower, and not a husqvarna.
reviews.author: Mowerman

reviews.title: "Good for 3 years only"
reviews.text: I've had this mowers less than 4 years and had to take it in for repair twice.  I've now spent nearly as much in repair as the original price.  This last time I only got one good mow before it wouldn't start again.  Problem with the carburetor design that it's too succeptible to getting dirty then it won't start.   I'm just going to have to buy a new mower, and not a husqvarna.
reviews.author: Mowerman

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: Started 1st try and cut the gas cleanly. What else can you ask for? The mower is light and powerful. Love the 4WD. For those of you who had trouble adding oil, I guess you've never done it before . My 14 year old did it w/o issues. And for oil changes ?? Manual states that there is no need, but clearly states (in the manual if you actually read it) how to do it of you choose.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Didn't last long before something went wrong"
reviews.text: I highly recommend tightening all the nuts everywhere. The first problem in less than 4 months of owning this, is the drive cable has gone slack. On a level yard, I reckon you wouldn't have this problem, but with a slope where you really need the AWD to get you up it, it doesn't hold up. (Currently trying to find out how to tighten it, but YouTube videos are lacking of the newer model) As of now, I got to pull the handle and then use my fingers to tug on the cable. The second problem was watching the handle fall off. One of the nuts had vibrated lose right off the bolt and disappeared. Why they didn't use the lock nuts is beyond me. (Assuming those nuts with plastic inside are called lock nuts.)Yeah, it's pretty easy to start up and use...  Just not for a larger yard or one with hills. The mulch feature may be great for leaves, but not for damp grass. It doesn't take long at all for the clump mess to build up and you may find yourself having to remove grass just to start it back up. It's not powerful enough to go through a modestly difficult yard. If you mow every week and manage not to have rain, you are good. If you try to go two weeks or there has been a rain...  Best of luck. I had to get a rider because it was just too much work getting this thing to do the job. Unless of course you are looking for a grueling workout!I have gotten pretty good with doing lawns over the years and I've learned the best trick to keep yard motors running is to use non ethanol gas so you don't have gunk buildup in the carbs. (At least make the last couple mows of the season use non ethanol gas so you can flush out the corn mess) I have cleaned, repaired, and replaced more carbs than I care to admit because of ethanol in the gas. So working on lawn mowers isn't new to me, I just love to watch a video first so I know what to expect. I seriously didn't expect to have to do any repairs in the first season though! Had I got through this season, I'd have given it more stars as I understand lawn mowers don't last long. But the AWD was one of the best features. To have to tug the wire to get it to engage is just ridiculous this soon! I'd highly recommend buyers invest in the models that give you the option of using the side discharge. It will come in handy for tall and/or damp grass.
reviews.author: Kenny

reviews.title: "Easiest starting lawnmower I have ever owned"
reviews.text: This unit is perfect for a yard that takes about an hour to mow. I can't believe how easy it is to start. One easy pull and it's up and running. Has good power, and the all wheel drive feature is a great especially on hilly sections. Mower's with rear drive wheels often slip on wet grass on the hills, but this unit keeps moving without slipping or tearing up the grass.
reviews.author: victor98

reviews.title: "Whoever designed this has never mowed grass !"
reviews.text: Why would you design this mower with no shroud covering the belt and pulleys? If I had looked underneath when I bought this mower I would have never made the purchase. All the grass/debris jams everything up from the front of the mower to the back. Already replaced belt/pulley and now the drive cable.  What a piece of junk....shame on me for not researching it better.
reviews.author: WillyB

reviews.title: "Poor Design for anything but smooth terrain"
reviews.text: TL;DR-Engine is underpowered for thick spots-Mulch gathers too easily under the deck-All-wheel drive is poorly designed and exposed to mulch and debris from the blades-Fuel tank is very small compared to other mowers-Parts missing from the mower right out of the box (wheel height grip)I purchased this mower in the store, enticed by the All-wheel drive. Husqvarna WAS a name known for quality, but this mower did not live up to the name.Right out of the box, I fueled and oiled the machine and went to work on the lawn. It was my first cutting of the season, so the grass was a bit taller than normal. I have level terrain (about 1/2 acre), partly shaded (the grass grows thicker in the shade and can be moist). The weather had been dry for several days and I cut in the afternoon on a sunny day.Right off the bat, the mower bogged down and had difficulty with the thicker patches of grass. Several times, the engine stalled because of mulch buildup under the blades. I then went to adjust the deck height only to find out that one the the height adjust handles was missing a grip. The mower performed only slightly better raised up, the engine continued to struggle and stall as mulch began to collect under the deck, rather than being returned to the soil.After completing a complete cut, I allowed the lawn to rest for two days before going over it again, with the deck lowered considerably for a close cut. The engine performed a little better this time as the grass wasn't quite as thick anymore and I thought perhaps this mower was alright after all. Then I hit a stick. This is something that every mower has encountered at one time or another, the stray stick or branch from your shade trees. Either dropped recently, or hidden in the grass, I do not know. Once the mower hit the stick, it encountered little difficulty turning it to mulch, but not before disabling the All-wheel drive system. Upon investigation, it seems the drive system uses a belt that runs under the deck and is EXPOSED TO THE MULCH! The belt and pulleys where all COVERED in MULCH! After clearing the mulch, I realized that a pulley came loose from being struck by the stick, causing the belt to slip. Not a difficult fix, but not one I should have to make after three days of ownership.  Needless to say, with a 30 day return policy, it is going back to the store.
reviews.author: Jeffrey

reviews.title: "Poor craftmanship!"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower roughly 6 weeks ago. I have cut my lawn weekly and the AWD has completely quit operating. The mower clogs easy due to the open undercarriage and dies. I enjoy mowing normally but this is an obsolete piece of equipment. I should have purchased the craftsman. I would highly recommend NOT buying this product until Husqvarna fixes its design flaw.
reviews.author: ryenb8

reviews.title: "Good mowing"
reviews.text: I purchased my husqvarna in 2013, I have used to mow my personal lawn and the lawns of a few Disabled Vets, never had an issue, it still running strong , and after sitting for the winter, with fuel stabilizer, usually starts within 3 pulls, and after that it's usually 2 tops. I was sorry to hear of the problems other has had, but mine is still going strong!
reviews.author: Blkdiamond

reviews.title: "Husky Mowers"
reviews.text: I have a Husky rider in Colorado. We are moving back to Texas and I couldn't think of a better mower to have for our new rent house. I bought this mower and unboxed it and put it together. Put some fuel and oil in it and pulled the start rope. Boom!!! Right on first pull, she fired and I went to mowing. Want a reasonably priced push mower??? Get a Husky!!
reviews.author: Jeff

reviews.title: "Easy to operate"
reviews.text: I bought this mower about 1-1/2 months ago.  It was easy to assemble and has been very easy to operate .  The all wheel drive comes in handy for the terrain that has to be mowed.  The only negative was the plastic unit that the cables come through on the handle was broken.  Gorilla tape temporarily fixed the problem till I get to a dealer to be fixed.
reviews.author: Mad Hatter 1

reviews.title: "Frustrated"
reviews.text: I never leave reviews, but frustrated to the point I couldn't resist. I thought I was buying quality.  Not the case.  Worked well for the first two seasons. Had carburetor replaced the beginning of this season.  Ran for two cuts and stopped running again.   For the record, I only have a quarter acre lot and I keep my mowers clean and services.
reviews.author: Chas

reviews.title: "Simple and Easy"
reviews.text: I put the mower together and was mowing in 10 minutes, super simple.  The mower was a single pull start, even the very first time.  The mower is a walk-behind and works as promised.  If I HAD to pick a con about this mower, is that the bag seems to fill fast and could seemingly be a bit bigger.  Overall, I am extremely happy with my purchase.
reviews.author: -cg

reviews.title: "Difficult to pull back"
reviews.text: If cutting under bushes, etc., one you move mower forward to cut, in pulling back, very difficult. Directions read that if this happens, push forward again to disengage gears. Really. It's like the old days of pushing a “grass cutter...push, pull, push, pull...  exhausting!  Heavy.  Sometimes I feel like I'm wrestling with this mower!
reviews.author: Mike

reviews.title: "Biggest waste of money in years"
reviews.text: I bought this mower being told it was a great buy.  It ran once then wouldn't start, no spark.  Took it in and was told we'd have to pay $150.00.  I refused and looked it up and there were widespread problems with a part.  Got the part replaced then it wouldn't run again after just one mowing.  Took it back in.  Got it back and wouldn't run again after just one mowing.  We've used it maybe 4 times and had it in at least that many.  Now it leaks gas like crazy from the bottom of the carb. There is a lot of cheap brittle plastic in it. Looks great but a 30 year old mower I found in the corner of the house we bought fired up on 1 pull.  This new hundreds of dollars waste of money refuses to start.  I love Lowes but hate Husqvarna.  Their customer support is a joke from what I've been seeing.  DO NOT buy this mower.  It's nice IF/WHEN it runs, but good luck.  I've heard others say they need full carb service after every season or it won't start up again.
reviews.author: angry

reviews.title: "Husqvarna is terrible"
reviews.text: we bought a new bagger push mower Husqvarna and a new big husqvarna riding mower, and a husqvarna tiller,  from lowes last summer,, nothing but issues on both,, the tiller ran for about 30 days great then started having issue, called lowes.. I ended up having to call husqvarna to refer me to a shop to look at them,, they said the push mower needed new carbs, new fuel lines ect,, on a mower that had been ran on and off for 30 days,, got it back ran it once then again same issues, then the tiller had issues wasn't running right,  took them  back to shop they said the was acting up needed replaced again so now we are again with out our mower and tiller for weeks during the summer , then the rider had same issues, we did work ourselves tired of waiting weeks for our equipment back.  rider worked good then started having battery issues,, our tiller they could never get to run right and husqvarna would never do nothing to help,, so I have this brand new tiller that no shops around here can get to run right just being a shop ornament,, the push mower still won't start,, and the tiller is dead,, 3 brand new husqvarna equipment all with issues barely have got to use in a year due to all the issues with them.  I will never buy another husqvarana anything, never had any issues with the john deer mowers,, or the cheap mowers/tillers we have bought,, we have had a troy built tiller we have ran for years and keeps on going,, wasted our money and can't get no one to get them going.  they lost our business
reviews.author: megz

reviews.title: "Need track shoes"
reviews.text: After I assemble the mower and found it very easy to start one pull and it started. The only thing I can say is that you will need to be in shape as there is only one speed on the all wheel drive and that is very fast. I was almost running to keep up the pace. For a person that is almost 70 years this is something to deal with.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Automatic choke and blade attachment delinquent"
reviews.text: Automatic choke does not permit lawn mower to restart after using one tank of gas for at least 20 minutes until mower cools off.Does start easily after waiting 20 minutes to a half hour.5 pins holding blade in place sheared off when going to replace blade.  Also replacement blade's quality is not as good as original blade
reviews.author: Glenn

reviews.title: "Not a happy owner"
reviews.text: Bought this mower last summer worked great stored as directed in my garage and now it won't start a bit changed the plug made sure I had good gas and nothing.  Have an old Craftsman riding mower that has sat out in the weather for a year charges the batter added gas and oil and started in 30 seconds. Won't buy another one.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Makes mowing easy!"
reviews.text: Mower works well. I did receive the mower with two defects, the fuel cap was broken and one of the screws was stripped. The instructions on how to register the mower were not clear whatsoever. The mower worked just fine, it doesn't work well with high grass when using the mulch feature. With low grass, it works just fine.
reviews.author: Rodney

reviews.title: "DO NOT BUY"
reviews.text: I used the mower twice and already needing repair.  Lowe's only gives a 30 day return policy on mowers.  I just over 60 days so I had to hand it over for repairs.  I guess there is a reason the return policy is only 30 days.  Even Lowe's doesn't want them back.  This mower ran fine for two mows.  Stay away from Husqvarna.
reviews.author: Robbed

reviews.title: "2 years old, this mower is awesome!"
reviews.text: I have some kind of steep hills on my yard so I wanted a self propelled AWD mower. I don't love it as much on the lower to the ground settings, but it is really really awesome on the higher to the ground settings. Doesn't bog for almost anything. Plenty of power and goes over almost anything. Really, really happy with it.
reviews.author: Bronson

reviews.title: "DOES NOT LAST!!!"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower new in June 2017.  I used this primarily to mow my 15' x 50' front lawn during the summer months (bermuda grass), mulch leaves and grass in the fall, and mow the 40' x 70' back lawn (rye and fescue) during the spring.  It worked great for a few months.  The first problem encountered was the drive lever cable stretching out so it would not engage the drive belt.  Shortly after that was fixed the plastic shroud under the deck that concealed the drive pulleys broke.  That was replaced and then the drive pulleys seized up.  Then the problems began with the Briggs and Stratton engine.  The automatic choke seems to have failed and is extremely difficult to start, if at all.  The mower was washed with the deck washing port on the mower after each use.  The spark plug and air filter were also cleaned regularly and changed this spring (2018).  Overall, very disappointed with this mower.  I do not feel Husqvarna are worth buying after this experience.
reviews.author: RG

reviews.title: "Ok mower"
reviews.text: Decent mower. Great if you have a flat lawn. Mower stalls out on extreme side hills. I ended up returning mine and bought the next model up with the Honda engine.
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "Disappointed in both Husqvarna and Lowe's"
reviews.text: Bought this mower on June 23, 2018 to replace old Husqvarna lawn mower - almost identical.  Our old one would start with first pull.  Was concerned about some of the reviews on this website about the engine but went ahead and  bought it.  Big mistake!  The new one has been nothing but trouble from start.  First week, it would not start after mowing 2/3 of yard.  Went to back Lowe's to see if something wasn't connected right or what might be going on.  Two employees said it was hot day and let cool down  since it was in break in period and check the air filter.  After it cooled down and with several pulls, it started.  This now this happens all the time!  Im getting old and pulling the cord multiple times is not easy and don't like having to wait on lawn mower to cool down to finish job.  In addition, the AWD now seems to work intermittently.  Called Lowe's about the issue and asked if I could replace it by upgrading to Honda engine as it had better reviews. Their response was you have to bring in for repair and then they will decide from there - what does that mean?  Why do I have to spend more money for a poor product?  Am a very loyal customer at Lowe's but this is a crappy Briggs and Stratton engine.  Stuck with a lemon and not happy with Lowe's customer service.
reviews.author: Frustrated

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: Bought this mower 4 month ago and-it has been in shop twice for awd repairs. Front wheels lock up and wont disengage even if you bump it forward. Its in the shop as I type now for same thing also worse. Wheels are locking up again and self propelled is making it go with the bar being pushed down. Junk Do not buy!
reviews.author: eggman

reviews.title: "Good mower"
reviews.text: I've had this mower for 5 months now.  Been very good to date.  I went from a 30 year old lawn boy, I can say it's about like going from a 5 year old ford truck to a new high end bmw car on how it works.  Starts on the second pull most always if not the first.  I had my hesitations at first being a brigs and stration engine since I've had experience on their older engines  in the starting area, some of the old briggs were really hard to start, this one not at all.  Seems to be a whole lot better on gas than the older lawn boy I had.  I mow on a little bit of a hill and the all wheel self propelled is great in that area.  if you mow around bushes/trees or get into a corner will roll without the self propelled yet not free rolling, can tell there is a belt tension on the wheels yet nothing I would be worried about for myself.  Only thing I will mention the gas cap will come off easy, brushed it against a bush limb a time or two and came right off.  For me that is really the only thing I will mention that could be worked on.  I used the mower enough to already sharpen the blade after 5 months so it's been worked out pretty good and had over all held up good.  I used a synthetic oil as recommended in the manual I could use being I use the same oil on other equipment I have, still working good.
reviews.author: Greyrider

reviews.title: "Great for hills!"
reviews.text: I had a self propelled Black Max from Samsclub and this is so much lighter and easier to maneuver in comparison. I used to have to help push my old mower up the hill but this takes off on its own. Zero effort for me, love it. Never going back to front wheel or rear wheel drive, all wheel is the way to go.
reviews.author: Unhatter

reviews.title: "Poor traction"
reviews.text: Somewhat under powered in relatively tall/thick grass, but works okay on shorter grass. The AWD system would most likely work a lot better if the wheels weren't made of a hard plastic composite...on inclines they'll just sit and spin. The main purposes of the AWD system is negated because of the wheels.
reviews.author: Spike1

reviews.title: "All-wheel drove mower"
reviews.text: The mower is easy to use and has good power. I have had some issues with long grass getting caught up in the belt system that drives the wheels which affects performance. But I have been able to clean out the grass quickly to get the mower operating again. Overall I like the performance and the styling.
reviews.author: G

reviews.title: "Warranty sucks, disposable lawn mower"
reviews.text: We purchased this lawn mower on 05/21/18, used it within the first week, then in August and one more attempt in September and it was completely dead. I let my son use the mower to catch up here and there, which yes, he might've hit a rock or brick...but that's not the point. When I used the mower it basically drags you, which is great. Overall, the performance was great until the 3rd attempt to use it shut down all the way. We took it into the Lowe's store because it is a push mower and not a ride on so they have to try to repair it at another facility. Well, they come back telling me that the crank shaft was broken, engine needs to be replaced, blade was damaged and they couldn't repair that under the manufacturer's warranty nor the extended warranty. Junk, bull and waste of money. How in the world could all of that have been broken if it worked perfectly fine in August, it just magically broke and now we can't use it and the repairs would most likely cost as much as the lawn mower.
reviews.author: Jazzymomof4

reviews.title: "Made cheap."
reviews.text: Handle comes loose and when you go to tighten bolts they strip. They are just big sheet metal screws, should be nuts and bolts. Also gas cap works it's way off while mowing. Also don't like the fact you have to push mower foward after disengaging the awd just to pull it back. Would not recommend.
reviews.author: Smitty

reviews.title: "Great mower - easy on the back!"
reviews.text: Wow! What a great mower. The 4-wheel self drive makes it so effortless to push. The blade cuts the grass like a hot knife through butter. Easy to start, easy to use, one of the best push mowers on the market. If you want a mower that's easy to use and easy on your back, this is the one to get.
reviews.author: FrankR

reviews.title: "Glad it was discontinued"
reviews.text: The rear grass discharge is a bad design. I thought it was going to be some form of amazing technology but I was wrong. Grass is always clogging at the rear. The 4WD is a great feature because I have hills in my yard. If it was not for the grass discharge problem this would be a great mower.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "piece of trash"
reviews.text: Bought it in July, used it only a few months. Put it up for the winter, will not start. Safety lever was stuck. Finally got it right and the cable was stretched. Try to find cable for this and see what happens. They forgot to tell parts stores this mower exists. Was finally able to find one.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Great product for price"
reviews.text: My lawnmower died and was beyond duct tape mid-mow. I went to two different stores to find a reasonably priced, good quality mower...this was it. In comparison to my old mower, this almost did everything but cut the lawn itself. I am very impressed with the options and quality of the mower.
reviews.author: Twisted

reviews.title: "Husqvarna AWD mower"
reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Started on first pull. Does good job. Recommended.
reviews.author: Codeslinger

reviews.title: "Absolutely disgusted with this mower"
reviews.text: We purchased this mower in early Spring of 2017.  It is now August 2018, and this mower has been to the local Husqvarna authorized dealer for repair twice this Summer for new belts.  I'm so over this mower.  I thought Husqvarna was a reliable product, I'm seriously rethinking this.
reviews.author: Ihatetomow

reviews.title: "Like Owning a Jaguar of old or Chrysler."
reviews.text: Its a good mower with High ownership costs.       And  This web site sure is a pain to post on.     But whatever there are full reviews on Youtube about this mower.   And yes,  you do need to be a Mechanic to work on this thing.   But its the ONLY mower of its kind on the market.
reviews.author: iMickey503

reviews.title: "Awesome power, AWD, and mulching"
reviews.text: I love this lawn mower--it has a little smaller engine than my old lawn mower but you can't tell and I like the fact that I don't have to drain/change the oil, I can just add more. The AWD is awesome and I just have to lightly engage the AWD to have the mower take off--I popped a wheelie the 1st time I used it. I always mulch and this beast has no problem. The wheels and tires are solid and grippy--with the AWD I have no problem gliding over wet/muddy areas where I got stuck with my old mower. According to the sales associated the AWD mechanical system is supposed to be all metal & belts unlike other brands that make self-propelled systems which can have a lot of plastic in them. The hose hookup and cleaning mechanism is not that great but I have never experienced one of those that work to really clean the underside--they don't seem worth the hassle. If I get the hose out I just squirt the underside of the deck by hand. Great mower for the price - got a memorial day special which brought down the price more.
reviews.author: richk

reviews.title: "Nice mower"
reviews.text: I like the mower however it's SO FAST,it does a good job but I need to find a way to slow it down, being a female and not real strong cutting the grass is one of my favorite jobs. The mower is strong and FAST ! If anyone can help me slow this thing down, please advise.
reviews.author: Peg 0

reviews.title: "You need to be in shape to keep up with this mower"
reviews.text: THIS PARTICULAR MOWER RUNS GREAT HOWEVER THE SPEED ON WHICH THE DRIVE GOES IS HARD TOO KEEP UP FOR AN OLD MAN, I KNOW IT'S VARIABLE SPEED BUT THE LITTLE UPS AND DOWNS OF A YARD , OR THE OCCASIONAL HOLES IN THE YARD CAN LET THE SELF PROPELLED MOWER GET AWAY FROM YOU
reviews.author: danny

reviews.title: "Worst mower I've ever owned!"
reviews.text: First off if you're wanting a mower that mulches or at least doesn't make you use the bag, this isn't for you! Also have had problems with the mower bogging down when the grass isn't really thick. The blades are really dull (and I've only used for a few months).
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "A BIG DISSAPOINTMENT"
reviews.text: The 4 wheel drive system is designed poorly. The front wheels will not release, even after pushing it forward as instructed. Grass clippings get caught under the covers and are impossible to get out without disassembling from underneath. What a piece of junk!!
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Do you like extra arm workouts?"
reviews.text: This lawnmower WILL stall on any setting lower than max. even if you do a half or quarter pass. it will still stall. it's trash, just like my husqvarna 440 chainsaw. both are less than a year old, I will NEVER buy a Briggs and Stratton or husqvarna again
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Really bad self propelled awd system!!"
reviews.text: I won't recommended this product because after do half of my front yard the self propelled system stoped working. I went to the store and changed for another one same model and after almost finish my front yard happening the same thing of the firt one.
reviews.author: JFD384

reviews.title: "More than we EXPECTED - Great Mower and Price"
reviews.text: This is a perfect buy for us because we had been looking for a  good budget self propelled mower with decent warranty.  Started on the first pull,  cuts thick high grass easily and the AWD gets the mower up & moving nicely.  Good price and good mower.
reviews.author: Charles

reviews.title: "Very Pleased!"
reviews.text: I purchased this mower for my son and he immediately liked everything about it. Started first pull out of the box. I knew the sale price was still on so I had to have one for myself too! I don't know how I, or my son, could be happier with this mower!
reviews.author: BKB

reviews.title: "No start after using 5 times!!!"
reviews.text: I have only used this 5 times over approximately 900 sq feet and now I cannot start it. So annoyed because of the cost and inconvenience already. Oil cap in placed in awful area and the mower is hard to pull backwards. Will never purchase another one.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Loud Engine Noise"
reviews.text: We bought this mower knowing it had been returned and thought it had been checked out and tuned up to be sure it was ready for a buyer.  When mowing, the engine sounds like it is struggling and grass seems to be whipped around rather than a nice cut.
reviews.author: Raydor

reviews.title: "Great!"
reviews.text: So far so good! Started on the first pull! Easy to use. The awd function works great. Cut the grass well and gets nice and close to trees and fences on both sides. Switching between mulching, throwing, and bagging is easy too. 100% would buy again.
reviews.author: Kholmed

reviews.title: "Powerful"
reviews.text: Overall a good lawnmower especially with the power drive however my lawn was a little tall and it did struggle to cut through in a few spots when in the mulching mode and mower is a little hard to maneuver in tight spots because of the weight.
reviews.author: Doc

reviews.title: "Do not buy this mower"
reviews.text: I bought this mower less than 1 year ago. Used it every week until winter. Would not start after sitting 3 m9nths. The warranty is a joke, no dealers in Florida can help me since theyou don't work on Briggs and Stratton engines. BUYER BEWARE!
reviews.author: Dawn

reviews.title: "NEVER EVER"
reviews.text: I really thought I was the only one that was having so many issues with this lawnmower. My neighbors get mad at me every time i mow because I start cursing after the fourth attempt of starting the lawn mower hasn't worked. Is there a recall?
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Difficult Self Propel Operation"
reviews.text:
It took 25 minutes to have this mower cutting grass from the time I pulled the mower still in the box out of my garage. It was very easy to assemble. The wheels were easy to adjust and it started on the first pull.

The first thing I noticed was the bag was small and the mounting bracket was difficult to get the bag on. Additionally, the mulching device was not attached. It is a separate device which I can see getting lost if you don't use it for a while.

I have now mowed my yard 3 times with this mower.

The big problem for me which causes me to not recommend the mower is the self-propel lever. It is okay if you are running it at full speed. At full speed, the safety lever and self-propelled lever are together at the handle and easily gripped. If you want to run at less than full speed, you have to open up your grip which makes it difficult to control and fatiguing on your hand. I also pinched my fingers multiple times engaging the self-propelled lever.

The self-propel issues may go away after using the mower for a while. I like the Thumb-Controlled Self-Propelled device on another major brand mower.

The mower does a nice job on zoysia grass. It has a very smooth cut right out of the box. I did not sharpen the blade.

If Husqvarna can come up with a better design on the self-propel lever, they'll have a good mower.
reviews.author: HisDudeness

reviews.title: "Best Mower"
reviews.text: I did my research before investing in this mower. My yard is too big for a simple push mower, but not big enough to justify a riding mower. I am on year two of ownership, and could not be happier. No issues, and cuts like a dream.
reviews.author: Lewis

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A"
reviews.text: I had a positive experience buying this mower and it has cut down on my mowing time thanks to the all wheel drivr (my back doesn't hurt as bad either.)Once you fine tune it, it cuts like a dream and leaves a professional look.
reviews.author: Bill

reviews.title: "Lemon"
reviews.text: Do not buy this product. We have had it two years and it has never worked properly. It has been in repair four times because the engine sputters and turns off after a few minutes. They've never been able to repair the problem.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Exchanged on the 3rd use"
reviews.text: This mower met my expectations the first two times I mowed my 1/4 acre lot. The third time I used it, I made it through half of the front yard and started to hear a mechanical pinging. I immediately shutdown and gave the engine a quick inspection. Didn't see anything obvious, so I attempted to fire it back up to listen again but couldn't get it to start. Waited 30 minutes before trying again and it fired on the first pull. The engine sounded normal initially so I went back to work. Made it 40' across the yard and the engine began misfiring, bogged down and died. I reboxed the mower and exchanged it for an identical unit. I've not had any issues with the new mower; However, it has only been used twice (fingers crossed).Overall the mower is easy to operate and the AWD really helps on uneven ground. I believe the first mower I received was a lemon and would consider purchasing again. My only complaint would be when not using the bag to catch clippings, the rear discharge ensures your feet and ankles will get dirty but does prevent the mower from slinging rocks.
reviews.author: Oldoak

reviews.title: "Best Push Mower I've Ever Owned"
reviews.text: Great mower that starts first time, every time. Solid construction, strong engine. Has AWD on this self-propelled mower. Very easy to push and steer, smooth, even cut. Highly recommend over Toro or other mowers Lowes sells.
reviews.author: Vic

reviews.title: "Powerful!"
reviews.text: Didn't realize how slow my old mower was till I bought this one! Takes half the time to cut yard! The four wheel drive lets me just walk behind with o issues maneuvering around objects! Highly recommend this product!
reviews.author: JB

reviews.title: "I love my HUSQVARNA"
reviews.text: I have had a few mowers over the years. I never took very good care of them so most only lasted three years tops. My Husqi is one tough machine, it never lets me down. It is still easy to start and runs like a champ.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Dissappointing."
reviews.text: I bought a Husq chain saw 10 yrs ago and it still is a good tool. I thiiught this Husq  lawbmower would be the same.  Nope.  Unpowered, poor performance.  Buy a differebt lawnmower.  Returned same day i bought it.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "I'm so disappointed"
reviews.text: Our last mower was a Husqvarna and it was a good machine. This one is horrible. There is no way to discharge the grass properly without the bag and it gets clogged, then stalls. Horrible design. It's going back.
reviews.author: Connie

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: THis mower is pretty heavy, but the all wheel drive makes it easy to use.  First pull start right out of the box. Plenty of power to make getting up my steep part a breeze.  My bank is about a 23 degree monster.
reviews.author: golfbum51

reviews.title: "Great Mower"
reviews.text: I bought this about a month ago and so glad I did. Came out of the box and only had to tighten four wingnuts. I filled it south had and oil pulled on the string and started before I even stoped pulling. NICE!!!
reviews.author: amphib222

reviews.title: "Husqvarna 163 cc"
reviews.text: The great part, Easy to start, will move a a fast pace.The bad, I had thick clover and the mower kept bogging down and dieing. Kept raising the mower until I got the yard mowed, then lowered and did it again.
reviews.author: Dwayne

reviews.title: "Great mower and engine but..."
reviews.text: It has adequate power even going uphill and can run away from you downhill, but it doesn't have an option to just shoot the trimmings out the side, so you either mulch or collect them which is time consuming
reviews.author: AJ

reviews.title: "6 months of a decent cut"
reviews.text: Bought this mower last June and was happy with how it started up easily. After a couple weeks I noticed that it started to run a little rough, and I'd have to make several passes to get even results. In the spring, the pull cord would get stuck, but the mower would start reluctantly, the first time I used it for the season. After a few starts and stops the cord would pull back. At this point I took it in to be serviced and was told the crank shaft was bent. "Not worth putting money in to." I was told. "Should have gone with the Honda engine" they recommended. Now I have a $300+ paper-weight. Here's the thing, though: the customer service line told me to take it in to a different service center to see if they'd repair it "under warranty". I called back to ask if there was any other solution, and that rep told me that a service center may be able to "pirate the necessary part from another mower to reduce the cost of repair." I'm extraordinarily dissatisfied with the craftsmanship of the mower, but moreso with the level of professionalism and service I received from Husqvarna.
reviews.author: krarox

reviews.title: "Beast"
reviews.text: I bought this mower shortly after purchasing my house. I bought it for the AWD, since my backyard is uneven and sloped with many dips/holes.  This mower has started on the first pull every time. The AWD gets it out of any pit I've put it in, and the mower itself has chewed up everything my yard has thrown at it.  Putting the side discharge at the rear is a great design, as I can get right up against obstacles on either side. The negative to that is that the discharge doesn't seat securely, so it has a tendency to get knocked off, although not that frequently.My major gripe with this mower has to do with the interaction between the mulch plug and the AWD. When you want to pull the mower backwards, make sure you've disengaged the AWD and pushed it forward for a short bit first. If you don't, then the drive will still be engaged, and will fight you.  With the mulch plug in, the AWD will try to engage all on its own, even when I hadn't used it at all since starting the mower that time.All in all, this mower has performed better than I could've expected, and I highly recommend it.
reviews.author: Jim

reviews.title: "Decent Mower"
reviews.text: I have this one as well as the Honda powered with larger rear wheels. I prefer the grips on the Honda as well as the larger rear wheels. This does well for a flat yard, tires spin a bit if grass is wet.
reviews.author: adam968

reviews.title: "This mower is awesome!"
reviews.text: A little finicky when using it for the first time, but after a few minutes she was taking down tall grass and powering around my crazy terrain like it was nothing. I'm very happy with this purchase.
reviews.author: Creepydude

reviews.title: "Handle too long, wont take mixed gas"
reviews.text: The handle is long and cannot be adjusted to be shortened, which will be a pain around the fence. I also do not like that it will not take gas-oil mix, which means I now have to get another gas can.
reviews.author: Darren

reviews.title: "Handle is too low"
reviews.text: This handle is made for people under 5' tall. I am over 6' and it kills my lower back. Does not turn and you have to let off of the power drive before you end a run to pull it back or it locks up!
reviews.author: Truebluefordman

reviews.text: Finally a lawnmower that my wife and kids can all start.  You barely have to pull the cord and it starts up everytime.  The all wheel drive flies up hills.  It mows great, no complaints at all.
reviews.author: BB

reviews.title: "Nice product"
reviews.text: I filled it with oil, gas as directed and pulled the cordOnce and it started right up. Runs great! I had a littleHard time with rear catcher until i figured it out.Other then that..great buy
reviews.author: Lour

reviews.title: "If I knew now..."
reviews.text: It's not at all surprising this is a discontinued model and to boot parts for this horrible machine are not a available. It worked great for the first 4-5 months and then nothing but trouble.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Home mower"
reviews.text: Bough this for my Dad. He used it 4 months then after that it would not start .He took it to get repaired  under warranty .The service place said it was abused and would not cover warranty.
reviews.author: Andy

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A"
reviews.text: Never owned this brand before.  So far, so good.  Very easy to start.  Cuts great and makes fast work of cutting the yard with the AWD.  We are hoping for many years of trouble free use.
reviews.author: Chip

reviews.title: "Great mower"
reviews.text: This mower is great. It starts so easily my 10 year can start. No bulb to prime and moves fast. I'm getting my lawn cut in 45 instead of 60 minutes with the previous self propelled.
reviews.author: bucksfan4547

reviews.title: "Best product for your money"
reviews.text: We were looking for a self-propelled mower with mulch and bag portions, and adjustable height of course. There's not a better mower out there with these features and price.
reviews.author: Qman

reviews.title: "Husqvarna Mower"
reviews.text: This lawn mower moves easily and cuts cleanly. Afterwards the portal to attach a hose and clean helps to keep it in running shape. Best mower our family has ever owned!
reviews.author: Nan

reviews.title: "Good thus far"
reviews.text: Time will tell if worthy.  Self propelled speed is ok, not as fast as I'd thought it be.  Very easy pull start and love the fast I don't have to change the oil on it.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Would strongly recommend this mower."
reviews.text: Cranks on the first pull. Cuts grass at a great pace. Would strongly recommend this as your mower. I really like the hose pipe connection to clean the under carriage.
reviews.author: JAP

reviews.title: "Excellent mower."
reviews.text: This lawn mower has worked admirably in cutting my grass during a very rainy season.  Its height settings take a little getting used too, but it functions amazingly.
reviews.author: CasusBelli

reviews.title: "Husqvarna LC221A lawn mower"
reviews.text: Really nice mower.  It pushes/drives nice and you can use the drive system or allow it to be a full push mower.  It's the nicest push mower that we've had to date.
reviews.author: 532sunset

reviews.title: "Love the AWD compatible"
reviews.text: Great cut and amooth AWD helps with hills in my yard and bag is convenient i can also get both front and back done on one tank and still have half tank of gas.
reviews.author: Greekandrew

reviews.title: "Only thing to make better is somebody else to use it for me"
reviews.text: Most of the reviews I see on here are user error. I have bad arthritis and the VARIABLE speed of the AWD make using it a dream. I've never had to pull the start rope more than 3 times BUT there are a couple things I wish they would change. After 30 minutes of use if I turn it off to refuel I have to wait about 5 minutes for it to cool down a little before it will restart. But thats a small price to pay for the ease of starting every other time. One other thing thats a bit of an issue is the drive belts under the deck do not have a cover and if something like a pebble or wood chip gets caught in the drive pulley the mower won't move or start. I had to take mine to the dealer for repair to learn this. The dealer just showed me the problem at no charge so the only other time its happened was an easy fix. The deck washing hose connection is of little use but nice to have. Overall I recommend this mower. AWD mowers are hard to find and usually very expensive. For the price this unit has been a life/money saver for a crippled old man like me. Pulling it backwards requires it be pushed forward about 3 or 4 inches to disengage the AWD
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Not worth the hype"
reviews.text: I bought this mower last July in 2018, it was used as a 2nd mower and not my primary. I like the power of it, the look and it truly is a 1 pull start machine. I used this thing maybe 7 times before season changed. In spring 2019 for the first cut I fired it up and was off. Only problem is the AWD wouldn't engage, tried it a couple more times and the belt burned up. Good thing it was April, I took it to a certified dealer for repairs. Here's the issue. HUSQVARNA created this machine with the pulley system and drive belt completely exposed. Then they attempted to cover the front and rear diffs. However, that just creates a huge void space. Grass collects there and gets stuck, used the hose attachment but that doesn't clean the drive motors. I had to take the back wheels off, and nearly the entire bottom plastic to clean it out. So right in the center where the pulleys and belt are... the is no protection, so the pulleys get jammed up with grass and the potential of the belt being cut is high. I got the mower fixed but now the front gear does not disengage unless I turn the thing off. Should have gone with the Briggs I was looking at.
reviews.author: Chux

reviews.title: "Awesome on hills"

reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Solid buy for the price point"
reviews.text: Recently moved to Western PA and found ourselves renting a house with about an acre and a half of property to manage. Our yards all vary in terrain, with the front having a very large hill, and the 2 other sections having large flat sections bordered by steady grades. That being said, I knew I wanted a propelled mower. This particular model fit the price point for keeping me under what I had been quoted for having a service mow at the intervals our yard needs. Setup was easy, basically just unfold the handles once it's out of the box. AWD and the rear left discharge have been legit for cutting back tall stuff.  Since I was about 2 weeks behind on cutting this year I switched between bagging, and the rear discharge for getting it down to a manageable length. The last 2 times I've cut I've just mulched.  The drive is engaged by pulling up on the lower handle, so, tightening or loosening your grip makes the pace variable. I am kinda peeved by the way the drive belt and pully's are exposed under the deck, but I keep that area clean after I use it, so no problems so far. I do use the deck wash attachment. It helps loosen up everything, but don't expect not to have to get your hands a little dirty to keep the deck clean. All that being said, I wish I could afford a riding mower. But, this mower is worth every penny.
reviews.author: Chief

reviews.title: "A good solid mower, starts easy like the AWD"
reviews.text: I am coming from a JD commercial grade walk behind, which admittedly spoiled me. It had a feature that allowed the engine to run but stopped the blade so you didn't have to restart it every time you needed to empty the bag, which I dearly miss and forgot to shop for when looking for a replacement. However, I was teaching my 12yo boy to mow the lawn and bought this one for us. It has been a month and both he and I have used it. It starts like a dream, no primer bulb, just pull the cord and it starts right up. The AWD is very powerful as I have a couple of small spots with and incline and loose soil that the RWD would spin out on, where this one goes right over without any loss of traction. I have two small complaints but I would still recommend the machine. 1) No side chute, I have been searching for an aftermarket compatible one, with little luck. Apparently many manufacturers are going away from the chute. 2) While the speed is technically "variable" it is dependant on how close you pull the drive lever towards the handle. It is not terribly comfortable to hold the lever an inch away from the handle while mowing, nor are you able to hold a consistent speed. I much prefer a preset adjustable drive speed lever to keep speed consistent. The boy loves this mower (more then the JD) so as long as he is cutting the lawn I am happy.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Best cutting mower I ever had."
reviews.text: I'm surprised of the low ratings this mower has because I have mine two years now and it's the best mower I've ever used but it has one quirk which I'll address now. If you use the self propelled feature, release the drive bar and immediately stop the mower the 4 wheels seem to stay in 4wd and is hard to pull backwards although the mower isn't prepelling itself anymore.  The workaround is to let off the drive bar and while the mower is moving under it's own momentum push it ahead another inch or two and the wheels will turn spin freely. After a little while you'll get the hang of it and it becomes a non-issue.Now briefly the rest.....I have a yard and not a lawn, follow me? I'll let the grass, crab grass and weed get a little high and this baby cuts beautifully and even mulches with out clumping, the grass catcher packs tight with clippings and holds alot before needing emptied and it's easy to remove and install. Mine is 163cc and I wouldn't want it any smaller. My yard drops about 4 feet at a 45º angle to the road out front and the 4wd pulls itself up and down the bank with one hand, no sweating in the hot sun. The self cleaning garden hose connection is kind of a joke but that's with all mowers, I have a paint scrapper tool I use to keep the clippings from building up under the deck. Clippings tend to build up under the front cover but that's easy to clean out. All mowers need maintenance throughout the summer. As with ALL power equipment don't use gas with ethanol, usually the middle and high grade gas doesn't have it. I'm buying another Husky to keep at my mom's house for her yard.

answers.text: Hi jb. Thanks for your question. The LC221A comes with a small container of oil to get you started. Thanks for considering Husqvarna for your outdoor power needs.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: Yes, engine oil is included.

answers.text: Yes. A small bottle of oil is included.

questions.question: "An this mower be pushed and pulled without the self propelled feature if desired, like a standard push mower that is not self propelled?."
questions.author: rezman

answers.author: Vinson
answers.text: Yes it can be pushed like a regular mower. The mower has been discontinued, parts are no long available. When the exposed drive belt goes out (mine did in less than 1 year)you will be stuck with a push mower. I asked Lowes why they are selling and offering a warranty on an item with no available repair parts and they simply said that they are just a retailer. Avoid this mower.

answers.author: Will
answers.text: Yes, this mower can be used without the self-propulsion. It takes some effort to push it, but it can be done. I highly recommend using the propulsion though, it is so easy to use!!

answers.author: Response from Husqvarna
answers.text: Hi Rezman. Sure. You would just let off the drive bail. The speed the mower moves is determined by have far you pull the drive bail. Thank you so much for considering Husqvarna for your outdoor power equipment needs.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
answers.text: No, this mower works as self propelled only.

questions.question: "I can't get the mower to start"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: Dan
answers.text: if it starts then stops after a few seconds its probably a carbureter issue. The butterfly valve on mine mower become stuck over the winter even though I had emptied the fuel. Access to the valve was easy by removing the air filter then the 4 screws ( 2 silver, 2 black) holding the carb cover in place. I cleaned the dirt from around the outside of the carb and sprayed wd-40 on the area where the valve shaft is connected ( NOT on the valve itself). In my case I think the automatic choke was sticking causing the engine to flood out after a few seconds.

answers.author: Response from Husqvarna
answers.text: Hello Lowe's Customer. My best advice it to check the step-by-step starting instructions included in your user manual. I imagine you're skipping a step or two if you're having such a tough time starting it. You'll also find fuel/oil mix ratio recommendations. If you're not following the recommended ratio, you can have big problems! Many times, the fix is something very simple. If you no longer have you manual handy, you can download a PDF on our website at: https://www.husqvarna.com/us/support/manuals-downloads/. Thank you for choosing Husqvarna for your outdoor power equipment needs.

answers.author: Mark
answers.text: Has it been used this year yet? If not, is the fuel fresh? I'd check the spark plug to make sure it's not fouled and you have a good spark. If sprk is good, it's probably a fuel issue. Fresh fuel is a must. If stored over the winter with fuel in the tank, the carb could be plugged with residue unless gas conditioner was in the fuel

questions.question: "mower will not self propel, is there supposed to be a belt under the deck"
questions.author: adam

answers.author: Vinson
answers.text: The belt may be jammed by debris. It is exposed to everything that you mow (pine cones, gumballs and sticks). My drive belt failed in less than a year. No replacement bet could be found...The mower has been discontinued. I paid extra money for a self propelled mower that won't self propel.

answers.author: Response from Husqvarna
answers.text: Hi Adam. Since it's difficult to diagnose the problem without seeing your mower, I suggest that you check out the troubleshooting guide in your user manual for tips, tricks, and solutions for common issues. Many times, the fix is something very simple. If you no longer have it handy, you can download a PDF on our website at: http://www.husqvarna.com/us/support/manuals-downloads/ We also have a handy FAQ section on our website where you can find answers to some of the most commonly asked questions by product category. Our FAQ page is located at: http://husqvarna.custhelp.com/ If all else fails, you can have the pros take a look! We have a convenient dealer locator tool on our website. You'll just need to input your city or zip code for a list of authorized Husqvarna dealers who typically offer both warranty and out-of-warranty service. Please visit: http://www.husqvarna.com/us/. questions.question: "Is the speed adjustable?"
questions.author: spicerj

answers.author: mb
answers.text: I purchased LC221A and it didn't come with a drive control though it says it is self propelled. A joke! I can barely push the thing!!

answers.author: Response from Husqvarna
answers.text: Hi spicerj. Yes, the self-propelling action is adjustable according to how far back you pull the drive bail toward the handle. The further toward the handle the drive bail is pulled, the faster the mower will travel. You stop by releasing the brake handle or the drive bail, and can stop the forward motion without stopping the engine itself by releasing the drive bail only. The self-propelled feature isn't like cruise control where it holds a certain speed. It's more that the mower propels forward without having to push the mower. Thank you so much for considering Husqvarna for your outdoor power equipment needs.

answers.author: CommunityAnswer
